loans.name: Ortik

texts.ru:
Ортык житель района Дж. Руми. Ему 42 года. Он женат и отец троих детей. Ортык умный, целеустремленный человек, и всегда думает о своей семье. Потому, что Ортык любить свою жену и детей. Все мужчины, такие как Ортык. Его старший сын похож на Ортык, он тоже самостоятельный парень и любить свою семью, и он находится на заработках загранице, чтобы зарабатывать и помочь папе обеспечить семью.  
Ортык на районе занимается животноводством. Он идет по стопам его отца. Его отец тоже занимался этой видом деятельностью. Ортык во дворе выращивает крупнорогатого скота уже 2 года. Он покупает скота и откармливает их в течение определенного времени и перепродает их на скотном рынке. Ортык обратился за кредитом, чтобы расширить свою деятельность. Он считает, что набрал опыта и пора продвигать бизнес на новый уровень. Ортык за счет денег купить несколько скота. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ему достичь своих целей и улучшить условия жизни семьи.
texts.en:
Ortik is a resident of the J. Rumy region. He is 42 and married with three children. He is an intelligent, purposeful person who always thinks about his family, since he loves his wife and his children, who are all men like their father. His oldest son resembles him and is also an independent guy who loves his family and is working abroad in order to help provide for them all. 

Ortik works in his region in animal husbandry, having followed in the footsteps of his own father, who also worked in this kind of business. He has been raising cattle on his property for two years already. He buys cattle, fattens them over a certain amount of time and then resells them at the market. 

Ortik is looking for a loan so he can expand his business. He thinks that he has enough experience and it's time to bring the business to a new level. He wants to use the loan amount to buy a few head of cattle. The loan will help him achieve his goals and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand his animal husbandry business by buying a few head of cattle

loans.name: Libradilla

texts.en:
Libradilla is 33 years old, married, and has four children who are in school.

Libradilla is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Libradilla has been buying and selling livestock for two years now, and she has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

Libradilla requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

In the future, Libradilla would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huong, born in 1989, a Thai-ethnic woman, has been in the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner since January, 2007. She currently lives with her husband and her two daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family’s main occupation is animal breeding, and each year she can sell three pig herds, getting income of about VND 60 to 70 million. However, after deducting the cost of buying a breeding pig and food for it, the remaining income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and save a small amount of money. She wants to buy more breeding pigs, but the saved amount is not enough. That is the reason why she wants to borrow a loan, to invest in pig breeding.
	
She hopes the loan amount will help her family have money to invest in breeding more effectively, and when selling the next pig herd her family can get a considerable profit.

loans.use: to invest in pig breeding

loans.name: Claudia Alejandra

texts.es:
Ni el alto costo de los insumos ni la competencia que se vive en sector porcícola, hacen que Claudia se rinda en el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.

Claudia es una madre muy responsable que trabaja fuertemente en beneficio de sus hijos, pudiendo así darles el sustento y educación que necesitan sin descuidar en ningún momento el amor y el cuidado que una madre puede ofrecer.

Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos de levante para capitalizar su negocio, ya que es este su único medio de trabajo y supervivencia.

Con este crédito podrá sacar adelante a su familia y su actividad.
texts.en:
Neither the high cost of supplies, nor the competition that is alive and well in the pig industry, has made Claudia give up on her commitment to her goals and dreams. 

Claudia is a very responsible mother who works hard for her children, in this way she can give them the sustenance and education that they need, without ever not providing the love and care that every mother gives their children. 

Claudia seeks a loan to buy to buy pigs to raise in order to capitalize her business, this is her only form of work and her means of survival. With this loan Claudia can help her work progress and care for her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise in order to capitalize her business.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mildred is 45 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Mildred has a weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials for her business.

Mildred has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Hanh's Group

texts.en:
Hanh, born in 1982, is the Thai ethnic woman. Her family has four members, including her husband, her two sons, and herself. The family is now living in the Mai Son District in Son La Province. 

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation and breeding. Her family has about 0.7 hectare of cultivated land of coffee. The income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and to save a small amount of money. She wants to buy fertilizer for the coming coffee crop, but the saved amount is not enough. Thus, she hopes that she can borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for the coffee.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time and hopes that the loan will help her family to invest in the coffee more effectively with high productivity by having many coffee trees laden with fruit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Uom's Group

texts.en:
Uom, born in 1966, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband, her son, her daughter-in-law, and her granddaughter in Mai Son district, Son La province. The main source of income for Uom’s family is agriculture. She breeds chickens and ducks to improve her family’s nutrition and get additional income. Uom’s income is just enough to cover her family’s living expenses.

Uom is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her coffee field to improve the coming coffee crop. She will use her loan to help her family invest more effectively in their coffee crop. Uom hopes that her willingness to learn will make her coffee field next year be laden with fruits. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Tam's Group

texts.en:
Tam, born in 1981, is a Thai ethnic man. He lives with his wife and one son and one daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province. Tam’s elder son is at primary school and his younger daughter is at kindergarten. The main source of income for Tam’s family is from agriculture. His family has about 1.3 hectares of cultivated land where they grow coffee. The income from coffee is just enough to cover the living expenses of the whole family. 

Tam is requesting a loan to buy additional fertilizer for his coffee field to increase his yield.  He expects to use the profit from his loan to help his family, care for his coffee field well, and prepare for an abundant crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sacpulupense Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Sacpulupense” is made up of eleven women who live in a rural area of Chichicastenango, Guatemala. The ladies share that their businesses have improved with their first loan and they are requesting a second loan that they hope will be funded by Kiva lenders. The majority of the women work creating and selling the beautiful traditional textiles of the area that enjoy great demand, especially from admiring tourists.

Rafaela is a multi-tasking 49 year old member of the Trust Bank. She has two children and as a widow, is the sole breadwinner of the family. She has a traditional textile business and sells colorful blouses called “huipiles” as well as tablecloths and napkins. Rafaela has a second business raising animals including chickens and pigs. She is requesting a loan to buy thread and supplies for her textile business so that she has plenty of inventory for her customers. And of course, her animals need feed as well.

In spite of the fact that she has not had any formal schooling Rafaela understands the importance of education both for her children and herself. At the monthly meetings of the Trust Bank, the ladies meet with a Friendship Bridge Facilitator who shares pertinent information with the ladies in their own indigenous language about a variety of subjects. They gain valuable business tools learning about budgeting, pricing, accounting, marketing and customer service. The women learn to identify their goals and dreams and begin to understand the steps to make them a reality. They also learn about nutrition, hygiene, health and how to get their children ready for school. “Microcredit Plus” is the name that Friendship Bridge gives to the combination of education and small loans. It is most effective!

Kiva lenders play a crucial role n funding loans for Rafaela and her friends in the Trust Bank. We look forward to providing a follow-up report in the near future! Thank you, Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy thread and supplies for her traditional clothing business so that she has plenty of inventory

loans.name: Florecitas De Xejuyu Group

texts.en:
San Lucas Tolimán is a town on the southeast of beautiful Lake Atitlan in the highlands of Guatemala. The Tolimán Volcano is one of the volcanoes on the Lake and right near the town. Eight ladies have joined together to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Florecitas de Xejuyu” which means “Little Flowers Below the Mountain”. The ladies have various businesses including animal husbandry, coffee production, fruit sales and a small convenience store.

The Secretary of the Trust Bank is 26 year old Claudia who has proven herself to be competent and responsible. She has two children who inspire her daily to work hard and succeed. She has a small plot of land where she has planted bushes and trees bearing bananas, plantains, papayas, and coffee. Claudia is requesting a loan that she will use to maintain her fruit trees and also purchase necessary items for coffee plantings.

The women gather together each month to transact business on their small loans. In addition, they learn about relevant subjects that support them in their personal and business lives. The Facilitator from Friendship Bridge, speaking with the women in their own indigenous language, shares information with them about how to manage their loans and small businesses effectively (budgeting, accounting, marketing, customer service). They also learn how to support their families in a healthy way as they learn about nutrition, good hygiene, the use of medicinal plants and healthy habits. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of education and loans “Microcredit Plus”.

Claudia and her friends in the Trust Bank are appreciative to Kiva lenders for funding these essential loans. They are poised to step into a more prosperous future, benefiting themselves, their families and their community of San Lucas Tolimán.

loans.use: to maintain her fruit trees and also purchase necessary items for coffee plantings.

loans.name: Wenefreda

texts.en:
Wenefreda is 68 years old now and is a married woman with eight children. For the past four years, she has run a tailoring business in the Philippines. Wenefreda is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Wenefreda is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy garments and other supplies for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy garments and supplies for her business

loans.name: Luvisminda

texts.en:
Luvisminda is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Luvisminda works hard to support her family. 

Luvisminda is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 52 years old and married. She has one child. Rosalinda works very hard to provide for the family.

Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 31 years and sells a variety of items.  

Rosalinda requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal care products, home care products, school supplies, and other groceries.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal care products, home care products care, school supplies, and other groceries.

loans.name: Sweet Gladys

texts.en:
Sweet Gladys is a woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sweet Gladys is 22 years old.

Sweet Gladys has a buy-and-sell personal care products business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell like perfume, lotion, etc..

Sweet Gladys has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like perfume, lotion, etc.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 54 years old and married with four children. For the past five years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Ana works very hard to provide for her family.

Ana is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, noodles, and other products. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, noodles, and other products

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 62 years old and widowed. She has five children. Victoria works very hard to provide for them.

Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, beverages, and other supplies.

Victoria has been in this business for 16 years and sells a variety of items. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to build her businesses further.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, beverages, and other supplies.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 46 years old, married, and has five children who are still in school.

Amelia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now, and she has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Amelia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is 44 years old, married, and has six children, four of whom are currently in school.

Lani is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for three years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

Lani requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional supplies for her business.

In the future, Lani would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 58 years old and widowed with six children. With one child in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years.  

Teresita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, beverages, and other groceries.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, beverages, and other groceries.

loans.name: Dana

texts.es:
Dana es una humilde trabajadora residente en el municipio de Puerto Boyacá con una vida colmada de sueños, esperanzas y los mejores deseos para su familia. 

Es madre de1 hija por la cual siempre ha tenido el valor y responsabilidad de responder para que su vida sea la mejor.

Hoy en día se gana la vida con la venta de alimentos como mecatos, dulces, golosinas, bebidas, y comestibles en una pequeña chaza.

Le dedica 8 horas diarias a su negocio.
De las principales dificultades que debe enfrentar en su trabajo son el alto costo de las materias primas y la competencia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de mecato al por mayor para tener una muy buena venta e inventario, así podrá tener los ingresos suficientes para continuar con su negocio y sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Dana is a humble, working resident of the municipality of Puerto Boyaca. She has a life filled with dreams, hopes and best wishes for her family. She is the mother of one daughter; she has always had the courage and responsibility to make her daughter's life the best.

Today she makes a living selling foods like pastries, sweets, candies, drinks and snacks in a small stand. She works 8 hours daily at her business.

The high cost of ingredients and competition are among the the major obstacles she encounters in her line of work. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of pastries at wholesale prices to have better inventory and sales, thereby attaining sufficient income to continue with her business and to support her family.

loans.use: buy pastries wholesale to have good sales and inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a buffalo

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Nora requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Nora has been in this business for 10 years. She also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Marelyn

texts.en:
Marelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Marelyn has been in this business for 10 years. Marelyn earns more income from food vending.

Marelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 39 years old, is married and has three children presently in school.

Jenalyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Jenalyn has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Ma. Arlene

texts.en:
Ma. Arlene, aged 42, is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She has one child in school.

Ma. Arlene has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw products and other ingredients for her business.

Ma. Arlene has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Ma. Arlene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy raw products and other ingredients for her business

loans.name: Rochel

texts.en:
Rochel is a married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 37 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rochel has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Rochel has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Rochel would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Diana Paola

texts.es:
Diana, con 25 años de edad, es una esposa responsable y amorosa.

Desde hace 8 años, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una sala de belleza que inició como alternativa para generar recursos que le permitieran velar por el bienestar de su familia, trabaja sola todos los días durante 5 horas.

Esta actividad la aprendió tomando clases en una academia de belleza y poco a poco fue adquiriendo más conocimientos y perfeccionando sus técnicas, lo que le ha permitido darse a conocer en el sector por la calidad de su servicio. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar los diferentes utensilios e insumos al por mayor (tratamientos capilares, tinturas, shampoo, acondicionador, entre otros), así estará en la capacidad de generar un empleo directo y además podrá prestar un mejor servicio, pues los clientes estarán más cómodos, lo que le ayudará a mejorar sus ventas y los ingresos que percibe. 

Diana con su perseverancia y proyección hacia un futuro, desea hacer crecer su salón de belleza, en el que pueda generar más oportunidades de empleo para madres cabezas de familia, dando como resultado un mejor bienestar no sólo para su familia, sino que aportará para que otras personas puedan disfrutar de mejores condiciones para vivir.
texts.en:
Diana is 25 years old. She is a responsible and loving wife. For 8 years, she has worked at her own business, a beauty salon that she started on her own initiative as an alternative for earning income that will allow her to care for her family's wellbeing. She works every day for 5 hours.   

She learned this activity taking classes at a beauty academy and little by little she acquired more knowledge and perfected her techniques. This has allowed her to become known in the area for her quality service. 

Right now, she is asking for help with the loan to buy different tools and materials wholesale (hair treatments, dyes, shampoo, conditioner and more). This way, she will be able to generate direct employment and in addition offer a better service. Her customers will be more comfortable and this will help her improve her sales and her income.  

With her perseverance and projects for the future, Diana wants to grow her beauty salon. With it, she can generate more employment opportunities for employment for mothers who head their households. The result will be better well being not only for her family, but she will be contributing towards other people enjoying better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy different tools and materials wholesale (hair treatments, dyes, shampoo, conditioner, and more).

loans.name: Tuoi's Group

texts.en:
Tươi is a woman of the the Kinh ethnicity who has been in the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner since January 2002. She always strictly complies with the regulations of the organization and helps other people in her group. She currently lives with her husband in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her main occupation is pig breeding, and each year she can sell from two to three tons of pork with an income of more than VND 100 million. However, the income after deducting invested cost is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and save a small amount of money. 

She wants to expand the breeding model but her saved amount is not enough to buy breeding pigs and food for them. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes the loan amount will help her invest effectively in the breeding and in the coming period she can get a considerable profit from selling pigs.

loans.use: to buy breeding pigs and food for them.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 45 años y lamentablemente, desde hace dos años está viuda. Hace un año comenzó un negocio vendiendo botanas, dulces y galletas. Con el paso del tiempo su negocio se convirtió en una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la que vende arroz, leche, maíz, frijoles, queso e incluso comida para perros y gatos. Maribel tiene un empleo administrativo en una empresa. Cada día tiene que transportar toda la mercancía que compra desde el mercado hasta su negocio. Además de su negocio, Maribel tiene un empleo administrativo en una empresa, pero su mayor fuente de ingresos es su pequeña tienda. Un préstamo de MXN 5,000le permitirá comprar más productos para hacer inventario, lo que elevará sus ventas un 50% aproximadamente. Maribel es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre ha luchado por conseguir lo mejor para su hijo, enfrentando los retos que la vida le ha puesto en su camino. Con este préstamo le ayudarás a Maribel a estar más cerca de cumplir otro de sus sueños: abrir su propio salón de belleza. Estará muy agradecida con Kiva y con aquellos que le den una mano para cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Maribel is 45 years old and sadly became a widow two years ago. A year ago Maribel started a business selling snacks, cookies and sweets. 

With the passing of time her business has turned into a small grocery store, where Maribel sells things like rice, milk, corn, beans, cheese and even pet food. Everyday she has to transport all the goods she has bought from the market to her store. As well as her business, Maribel has an administrative job at a business, but her greatest source of income is her small store. 

A loan of 5,000 MXN will allow Maribel to buy more supplies to fully stock her store, this would increase her sales by approximately 50%. Maribel is a very hard-working woman who has always fought to have the best for her son, facing all of life challenges that have come her way. 

With this loan you will help Maribel to move closer to fulfilling another of her dreams: to open her own beauty salon. Maribel is very grateful to Kiva and with those people that will give her a hand to fulfil her dreams.

loans.use: to buy milk, rice, corn, beans and other supplies.

loans.name: Natalia Andrea

texts.es:
Natalia es una mujer dedicada a su familia y a su labor. Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido salir adelante, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le han presentado. 

Desde hace 2 años inició su propio negocio, un salón de belleza que ubicó en un espacio de la casa donde reside, además, también presta el servicio a domicilio, según el requerimiento de sus clientes. 
Trabaja todos los días durante 5 horas sola.

Esto le ha permitido generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y a solventar las necesidades de su único hijo. 

El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de un secador para el cabello e insumos al por mayor (tratamientos capilares, shampoo, acondicionador, esmaltes para uñas, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y prestar un servicio más completo a sus clientes, de una manera más ágil y eficiente; lo que beneficiará el margen de utilidades que percibe por su labor. 

Natalia manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder continuar con su labor, acreditar y fortalecer bien su negocio para lograr ser más competitiva en el mercado y así tener la capacidad para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Natalia is a woman dedicated to her family and her work. Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to get ahead overcoming the obstacles in her way.

Two years ago she started her own business, a beauty salon which is located in part of the house where she lives. She also offers her services at people's homes if the clients requires that. She works every day for five hours by herself. This has allowed her to generate sufficient resources to support her husband with the household expenses and pay for the needs of her only child.

She will invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of a hair dryer and supplies, wholesale (hair treatment, shampoo. conditioner, nail polish amongst others). This will allow her to continue with her work and offer a more complete service for her customers in a more flexible and efficient way. This will benefit her profit margin that she gets for her work.

Natalia says that her main wish is to continue with her labor, establish and strengthen her business to become more competitive in the market and have the capacity to provide a higher quality of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and supplies wholesale (hair treatments, shampoo, conditioner and nail polish amongst others).

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina, 59, is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Florentina has a fish-vending business in the Philippines She has been in this business for eight years and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her business. 

In the future, Florentina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her business.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 40 years old, married, and has three children, who are in school.

Lea is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for four years now and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lea requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

In the future, Lea would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 36 years old and married. She has two children who are still in school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Eden runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Eden requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, canned goods, noodles and personal care products.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, canned goods, noodles and  personal care products.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 24 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a culminar sus estudios en belleza para salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Ella desea tener un negocio de centro de estética y belleza en el municipio de Puerto Boyacá.
Esta actividad desea iniciarla con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y para sus estudios, además de poder contribuir con los gastos en su hogar.
Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar elementos como herramientas de cepillado y corte de cabello, además de insumos como gel, cremas capilares, entre otros.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables y agradece a todas las personas que puedan contribuir con su sueño.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 24 years old. What she wants in life is very clear to her and she has decided to finish beauty school and get ahead and have a better life. She wants to have a beauty salon in the town of Puerto Boyacá.

She decided to start this activity in order to seek income to support herself and her studies and in order to contribute to the household budget. She is an enterprising and very disciplined woman.  

She is asking for a loan to buy items such as hair styling and cutting tools, as well as materials such as gel, hair creams, and more.

She hopes to be able to progress as a businesswoman and have more stable income. She is thankful to all of the people who can contribute to her dream.

loans.use: to buy things such as hair styling and cutting tools as well as materials such as gel, hair creams, and more.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 52 años, viuda, tiene 2 hijos independientes, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella emprendedora, independiente, amable, optimista, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Max Paredes’ muy conocida por su feria mañanera; mujeres que se dedican al comercio por las mañanas, venden todo lo referido a prendas de vestir, desde abrigos hasta zapatos, todo de su propia confección y fabricación. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Maria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza sola, vive en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, su rutina diaria comienza a las cuatro de la madrugada para llegar a su puesto de venta (cargada de diversas prendas de vestir) a las cinco. Sus clientes llegan de ciudades vecinas para comprar por docenas; cuyas tallas, diseños y colores atraen la atención de todo tipo de familias. A las nueve de la mañana  ella y los demás comerciantes deben abandonar las calles para dar paso a la apertura de las galerías comerciales. Cargada de sus prendas se dirige a su depósito, acomoda y guarda todo, “inicié mi negocio vendiendo de forma ambulante, luego conseguí un puesto fijo de venta y trabajo desde muy tempranas horas de la madrugada…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas constantes la desventaja es la falta de dinero para ofertar prendas de temporada. Su sueño es vender por mayor, ella desea realizar la compra de chamarras por mayor para vender en época de invierno. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamo con la institución en 10 años que desarrolla esa actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de chamarras de temporada para vender por mayor en temporada de invierno
texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old. She is a widow and has 2 grown children. Her business is selling second hand clothing.

She is enterprising, independent, friendly, optimist, patient, responsible and very hardworking. She runs her business in the ‘Max Paredes’ area, which is very well known for its morning market. Women who are merchants in the morning sell every type of clothing from coats to shoes, all made by them. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies between 0-12 degrees centigrade.

Maria has dark skin, brown eyes, long brown hair that she wears tied back, short stature and a robust frame. Her mother tongue is Aymará, which she speaks in her family. She speaks Spanish in the general culture and for her business. She lives alone in a house owned by the family. It is made of brick and cement with a metal sheeting roof and a wood floor. It has potable water, electricity and plumbing. Her business is selling second hand clothes. Her daily routine starts at four in the morning, to get to her sales stall (carrying different items of clothing) at five. Her customers come from neighboring cities to buy by the dozen. The sizes, designs, and colors attract the attention of all types of families. At nine in the morning she and the other merchants must leave the streets so that the commercial galleries can open. She carries her clothing to her storage place, and she arranges and puts everything away. “I started my business as a street vendor. Later I obtained a sales stall and I work from the very early morning hours…” she says. The advantage of her business is that she has stable sales. The disadvantage is the lack of money to offer seasonal clothing. Her dream is to sell wholesale. She wants to buy jackets wholesale to sell for the wintertime. This is her second loan cycle with the institution during the 10 years she has been doing this activity.
 
It is for these reasons that Maria is asking for a loan to buy the seasonal jackets to sell wholesale for winter.

loans.use: to buy seasonal jackets to sell wholesale in the winter.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 36 years old, married with two children.

Marife works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Marife has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Marife aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie works hard to support her family. Rosie is married and has a raising chicken business in the Philippines.

Rosie requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chicken.

Rosie has been in this business for 3 years now, and also earns additional income from farming banana fruit.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens

loans.name: Francy Elena

texts.es:
Francy es una joven de campo y madre de 1 hijo de 5 años por el que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de cerdos a las afueras del municipio de Medellín.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar algunos cerdos para cría.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para ella y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposo y su hijo.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a una mujer trabajadora con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Francy is a young woman from the country and the mother of a 5 year old son. She has been through much adversity in her life. However she has had the strength to get ahead and continue to progress with her family. For some time now she has wanted to start a business raising and selling pigs on the outskirts of the municipality of Medellín.

So she is requesting a great economic boost to buy some pigs to raise. With this new business she can generate income for her family which is everything to her and she can improve the quality of living for her husband and child. She will work every day to foster her business and make it a sustainable and profitable business. Help a working woman with a loan!

loans.use: to buy some pigs to raise.

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Diana encuentra en sus pollos esa oportunidad que siempre ha soñado de poder pagar una educación de calidad para su hijo y tener el sustento diario para sobrevivir.

Hoy en día se siente muy orgullosa de lo que ha podido construir hasta ahora gracias a su dedicación, esfuerzo y trabajo duro.

Solicita un crédito para comprar algunos pollos para la cría y gallinas ponedoras.

Es una actividad realizada con todo el cariño y empeño que solo una madre puede tener.
texts.en: Diana has found in her chickens the opportunity she had always dreamed of to be able to pay for a quality education for her son and have the daily sustenance to survive. Today she feels very proud of what she has been able to build so far thanks to her dedication, effort and hard work. She is requesting a loan to buy some chickens to raise and some laying hens. This is a business done with all the love and determination that only a mother can have.

loans.use: to buy some chickens to raise and some laying hens.

loans.name: Thuon's Group

texts.en:
Thuộn, born in 1972, is a Thai ethnic woman who joined the program of M7-MFI in December, 2013. She currently lives with her husband, her son, her daughter-in-law and their two children in Mai Son district, Son La province.
 
Her family makes a living by cultivation and animal breeding. The local people around her family often use chemical fertilizer for cultivation so the productivity is not as high as their expectations. Knowing that, she wants to change her mind by using organic fertilizer instead of chemical fertilizer for the coffee crop, but she does not have enough money to buy organic fertilizer. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose. 

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the coffee field with high productivity while protecting the environment.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Daniela Eliana

texts.es:
Daniela vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba - Bolivia, es la segunda hija de dos hermanos, su mamá trabaja como niñera y su papá tiene un taller de chapería mecánica. Actualmente Daniela se encuentra cursando el séptimo semestre de la carrera de Propaganda, Publicidad y Marketing, por lo que solicita un crédito educativo para poder concluir sus estudios ya que los ingresos que percibe su familia solo alcanzan para los gastos del hogar. 
Daniela se considera una persona estudiosa, trabajadora y perseverante, su sueño es poder especializarse en marketing político y poder abrir una consultora, la cual le permitirá mejorar su situación económica y ayudar en su hogar, haciéndose cargo de sus papas y apoyando a su hermano. 
Daniela agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos ayudan a los jóvenes y generan nuevas oportunidades para sus estudios.
texts.en:
Daniela lives in the city of Cochabamba, Bolivia.  She is the second daughter of two siblings.  Her mother works as a nanny and her dad has a mechanic and bodywork shop.  Currently Daniela is studying in the seventh semester for her degree in Advertising, Publicity and Marketing.  For this reason, she is requesting an educational loan to be able to finish her studies since the income that her family receives is only enough for the household expenses.

Daniela is considered to be a studious, hardworking and persevering person.  Her dream is to be able to specialize in political marketing and to be able to open a consulting firm, which will allow her to improve her financial situation and help at home, taking care of her parents and supporting her brother. 

Daniela is grateful to the people who, through financial resources, help young people and generate new opportunities for their education.

loans.use: to pay for her degree in Advertising, Publicity and Marketing.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 50 years old and has three children. Elma is married and one of her children is in school.

Elma is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Elma has been in this business for 31 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Elma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a 51-year-old woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Vivian has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy raw products and other ingredients for her business.

Vivian has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy raw products and other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 59 years old, married with three children.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

Ruby runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional supplies to sell in her general store. Ruby has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from electronic mobile load retailing. She has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Ruby aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 44 years old with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Susana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.  She has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Susana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 10 years. Rosemary earns additional income from raising pigs.

Rosemary has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Medina is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Medina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Medina requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gear for her business.

Medina has been in this business for 10 years. Medina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Niem's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nien, born in 1984, is the Thai ethnic woman. Her family has four members, including her husband, her two daughters and she. Her family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation so the income after deducting costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount of money. 

She wants to go to the hospital to have medical check-up but her saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.
She hopes that the loan amount will help her can have an opportunity to check her health, and she will work hard to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to have a medical check-up

loans.name: Neng's Group

texts.en:
Neng, 44, lives with family members in the rural village of the Mondulkiri province and a mother of eight children. Nowadays, she grows cassava as the main source of income. Moreover, she can earn extra income via driving a taxi. 

For Neng, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. She leads a group of four members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan to buy farming supplies to support her current business. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Sophun

texts.en:
Sophun, aged 24, is a third-year student who is studying at a university in a province and she is from the Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sophun is pursuing a bachelor’s degree with a major in banking and finance. Her father is a farmer who earns main income from his potato plantation and his mother fattens pigs to sell to support their family. 

Now she is applying for a loan because she needs finances to pay for her tuition fees from the third through her fourth year. This loan will help her have enough finances for earning a bachelor’s degree. For her dreams after graduation, she hopes to have a good job, so she will be able to help her parents.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees in banking and finance from the third to her fourth year

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is a woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosana is 39 years old and has five children who are in school.

Rosana has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Rosana requested a PHP 5500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosana has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Rosana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 44 years old and has ten children. Myrna is married and has six children who are currently in school.

Myrna is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Myrna has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy works hard to support her family. Nancy is married and has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines.

Nancy requested a PHP 11500 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her manicure and pedicure service.

Nancy has been in this business for 20 years now, and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her manicure and pedicure service

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia is 63 years old, married, and she has three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Virgenia is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her business. Virgenia has been in pig fattening for 11 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pig business.

loans.name: Lorelyn

texts.en:
Lorelyn is a married woman with one child. She is 33 years old and her child is still in school.  Lorelyn is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lorelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, hot dogs, chicken, spices, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business.

Lorelyn has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, hot dogs, chicken, spices, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
A local resident from Kratie province, Sarom is 27 years old and a mother of one schoolchild. She struggle her family hardship via cassava growing. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can get more income to update her living better than before.

loans.use: to pay for her plowing fees

loans.name: Man's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Man, born in 1987, is a Thai ethnic woman. She lives with her husband, her parents-in-law and her two children in Mai Son district, Son La province. 
Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding, so the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the whole family and saved a small amount. She wants to buy fertilizer for the next coffee crop but that saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.
She will find an additional job to work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, hoping that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the coffee with the productivity is higher than the last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her coffee plantation

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавчуда молодая и красивая девушка города Вахдат. Ей 20 лет. Она не замужем. Мавчуда в городе живет вместе отцом и матерью. У нее средне образование. Она не поступила в университет, потому что хотела заниматься своим ремеслом. Она шьет женскую одежду на заказ. У нее много клиентов, и количество клиентов постепенно возрастают. Мавчуда научилась кроить и шить 3 года назад. Сейчас ее  родители решили отремонтировать дом, чтобы улучшить жилищные условия жизни семьи. Но для купли стройматериалы не хватает денежных средств. Мавчуда решила взять кредит и помочь родителям приобрести стройматериалы для ремонта дома. Она надеется, что Вы поможете им приобрести стройматериалы и отремонтировать дом. Мавчуда будет рада на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Mavjuda is a beautiful young woman from the city of Vahdat.  She's 20, unmarried, and lives in the city together with her father and mother.  She has a secondary school education.  She didn't go to college as she wanted to work in her trade; she sews women's clothing to order.  She has a lot of customers, and the number of her customers is constantly growing.  

Mavjuda learned how to cut and sew clothing 3 years ago.  Currently, her parents are seeking to finish renovating their home to improve the family's living conditions, but they lack the money to buy building materials.  Mavjuda has decided to take out a loan and help her parents obtain the building materials needed to renovate their home.  She hopes that you'll help them acquire these materials and finish renovating their home.  Mavjuda will be grateful for your support.

loans.use: buy building materials to renovate her home

loans.name: Nicanie

texts.en:
Nicanie is 32 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Nicanie works very hard to provide for them.

Nicanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries like detergent soap, sanitary pads, diapers, vinegar, hair conditioners, etc. to sell.

Nicanie has been in this business for 3 years 

Nicanie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries like detergent soap, sanitary pads, diapers, vinegar, hair conditioners, etc. to sell

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly works hard to support her family. Beverly is married and has a weaving business in the Philippines.

Beverly requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her weaving business.

Beverly has been in this business for 15 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Rheami

texts.en:
Rheami works hard to support her family. Rheami is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rheami requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rheami has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Rheami would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Procesa

texts.en:
Procesa is 51 years old with six children. Procesa works very hard to provide for them.

Procesa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

Procesa has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Procesa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Yeon's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kratie province, Yeon is 41 years old and a mother of three children. Because of her family’s living, she grows cassava and rice as the main source of her income. For Yeon, this is her third cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. 

She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get a good yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava farm to get a good yield from the next crop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy piglets and food for the pigs

loans.name: Virgen Asunta De Huyro Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE HUYRO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Melchora, la socia tiene 47 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a al cultivo de frutas como platanos, naranjas entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado  y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Virgen Asunta de Huyro communal bank. The bank is located in Huayopata district, which is in La Convención province and Cusco department. 

The member, Melchora, is 47 years old, has 3 children, and is single. She alternates her daily tasks with working growing fruits such as plantains, oranges, and more. The member is a responsible and persevering person. The member wants to be able to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family. 

The member asks for the loan to purchase seeds and organic fertilizer.

The members are grateful for the granted loan and promise to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, iron, beams, and doors to finish building his house.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 63 years old and married with four children. Roselyn works very hard to provide for them.

Roselyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more items of groceries to sell like juices, drinks, milk, coffee, breads, canned goods, noodles and personal care products.

Roselyn has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items of groceries to sell like juices, drinks, milk, coffee, breads, canned goods, noodles and personal care products

loans.name: Cleo

texts.en:
Cleo is 37 years old with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Cleo runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell including canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.  She has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Cleo would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell including canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
La socia Eva se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de alimentos, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Eva, continues working selling groceries. She sells basic products such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. She has been in this business for 5 years now, and it is going very well for her. The member's dream is to expand her grocery store. She asks for the loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. 

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La socia Delia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Delia, continues working selling basic items. The member sells basic products such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. The member, through this business, wants to get ahead. The member is an enterprising and hard-working woman. The member's dream is to expand her grocery store business. The member asks for the loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies. 

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Tania Liseth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRABAJADORAS DE HABASPATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Tania Liseth se dedica a trabajar en un hospital,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es mejorar en su trabajo.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Trabajadoras de Habaspata communal bank. The bank is located in Vilcabamba district, which is in La Convención province and Cusco department. 

The member, Tania Liseth, works in a hospital. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. The member has been in this business for 5 years and it is going very well for her. The member's dream is to improve in her work. The member asks for the loan to purchase a television for her home.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase a television for her home.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia Bertha  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante y sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tomates, zanahorias, cebollas y zapallos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Bertha,continues working selling vegetables. The member is a hard-working woman who, through this business, wants to get ahead and get her family ahead. The member asks for the loan to purchase tomatoes, carrots, onions, and squash. 

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, carrots, onions, and squash.

loans.name: Sumac Puririsun Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina ella es soltera y tiene 43 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia es una persona trabajadora y luchadora que por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
La socia que esta tapada con un circulo su cara ya no pertenece al banco comunal Sumac Puririsun 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the “SUMAC PURIRISUN” communal bank, situated in the district of Cusco, which belongs to Cusco province and Cusco department. 

Luz Marina, who is a member, is 43 years old, is single and has 2 children. She works in her business selling and rearing animals. She breeds the chickens and guinea pigs, grows them, fattens them and sells them at the various markets.  She is a persistent and hard-working person, who wishes to move ahead with this work, and thanks to her small business she is able to bring up her children. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell the chickens and guinea pigs. 

Luz Marina is asking for the loan to buy chickens and guinea pigs and feed for them. The other members have businesses selling beauty products, crafts, groceries, and animals. Luz Marina is grateful to those who are helping her achieve her dream in this way and promises to pay her installments in the agreed timeframe.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies so he can plant corn with his grandfather.

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en:
Mansueta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Mansueta requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Mansueta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Angie Sandrith

texts.es:
Angie es una joven de 18 años de edad, que desde hace 4 años comenzó a trabajar en diferentes actividades, actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes que un familiar le cedió para que la trabajara y generara ingresos para sustentar los gastos del hogar.

Este negocio lo atiende todos los días de durante 8 horas y, a pesar de la competencia que existe en el sector, ha obtenido buenos resultados, generando ingresos suficientes para sostener sus estudios universitarios.

El crédito que solicita con la Corporación Interactuar es un apoyo para comprar surtido al por mayor como mecato, lácteos, galletería, granos, entre otros, esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades inmediatas de sus clientes, aumentando las ventas e ingresos que recibe por su labor.

Angie, con su espíritu de superación y las ganas de salir adelante con su familia, lo impulsan a seguir luchando y avanzar para cumplir el sueño de ser profesional, y poder disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia.
texts.en:
Angela is an 18-year-old young woman who started to work 4 years ago in different activities.  Currently she has a grocery store that a relative handed over to her so that she could work in it and generate income to help with the household expenses.  She works in this business every day for 8 hours and, despite the competition that exists in the area, she has obtained good results, generating enough income to support her university studies. 

The loan that she is requesting from Corporación Interactuar is financial support to purchase an assortment of wholesale products like snacks, dairy products, cookies and grains, among other things.  This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products to satisfy the immediate needs of her customers, increasing her sales and the income that she receives from her labors. 

Angie's desire to succeed and will to have her family get ahead drives her to continue fighting and making progress in order to fulfill her dream of being a professional and to be able to enjoy a better quality of life in the company of her family.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale an assortment of snacks, dairy products, cookies, and grains, among other things.

loans.name: Phon's Group

texts.en:
Phon, a farmer living in Prey Veng province, is 35 years old and the mother of four children. Nowadays, she needs to support three children, two of whom are still in school; the other one is too young.

Phon earns income to support her family via rice cropping and duck-raising. For Phon, this is her second cycles with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. In a group of two, she is the group leader. 

She will spend her entire portion of the loan to buy duck feed and pay a machine to plow her farm. She hopes that she can get more income to update her living and support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy duck feed.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Sopary

texts.en:
Sopary is 19 years old. She is the daughter of a family who resides in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in medicine, and is in the first year of university in the province. Her parents are farmers. 

Sopary is requesting a loan because she lacks the finances to pay her tuition fees from the first to the third year. This loan will help her graduate successfully and earn skills to achieve her future goals. In the future, Sopary hopes to run her own clinic. She also wants to save money to build her own house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees from the first to the third year.

loans.name: Dolores Armida

texts.es: Dolores una mujer de 45 años vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 10 años por lo que es muy reconocida en el lugar donde vive por ser una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable. Ella se dedica a la costura elaborando trajes de señoras, pantalones para hombres y camisas Dolores es muy preferida por la calidad de su trabajo y porque les da precios accesibles y es gracias a ello que sostiene, la economía de su hogar. Dolores ha invertido sus ahorros para hacer un cuarto dormitorio ya que siente que viven en hacinamiento, por lo pequeño de su vivienda, es por eso que ella está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: arena, cemento, ladrillos, hierro, lamina y polines para construir un cuarto dormitorio y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones habitacionales de su familia.
texts.en: Dolores is a 45 year old woman who lives with her husband and 10 year old son. She is known in the place that she lives as a very hard-working and responsible woman. She works as a seamstress making woman's dresses, pants for men and shirts. Dolores is popular due to the quality of her work and because of her accessible prices. Thanks to this she supports the household economy. Dolores has invested her savings to build a bedroom as she feels she lives in very little space since her house is small. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy sand, cement, bricks, re-bar, laminated sheeting and beams to construct a bedroom and in this way improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, bricks, re-bar, bricks, laminated sheeting and beams to construct a bedroom.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal TRABAJADORAS DE HABASPATA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de La Convención, distrito de Vilcabamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Bertha, continua dedicándose a enseñar a niños de primaria, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de vivieres para su hogar como arroz, azúcar entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Trabajadoras de Habaspata communal bank. The bank is located in La Convención province, Vilcabamba district, and Cusco department. 

The member, Bertha, continues working teaching primary school children. She is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments. She wants to be able to continue working so that, in this way, she can continue supporting her family. 

The member asks for the loan to purchase groceries for her home such as rice, sugar, and more.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for her home such as rice, sugar, and more.

loans.name: Sehila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal TRABAJADORAS DE HABASPATA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de La Convención, distrito de Vilcabamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Sehila continua dedicándose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua  vendiendo  diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Trabajadoras de Habaspata communal bank. The bank is located in La Convención province, Vilcabamba district, and Cusco department. 

The member, Sehila, continues working in her grocery store business. She is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make her payments on the established schedule. The member continues selling different types of products such as rice, sugar, and more. She wants to be able to continue working so, in this way, to continue supporting her family. 

The member asks for the loan to purchase sugar and more.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and more.

loans.name: Liseth Magaly

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRABAJADORAS DE HABASPATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Lisetth Magaly  continúa con su negocio de planes de seguridad, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua haciendo  mantenimiento en las diferentes calles de la ciudad, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para uso personal para comprar vivieres para su hogar como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Trabajadoras de Habaspata communal bank. The bank is located in Vilcabamba district, which is in La Convención province, and Cusco department. 

The member, Liseth Magaly, continues in her security plan business. The member is a responsible and persevering person. She continues performing maintenance on the various streets of the city. The member wants to be able to continue working so that, in this way, she can continue supporting her family. 

The member asks for the loan for personal use to purchase groceries for her home such as rice, sugar, milk, and more. 

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for her home such as rice, sugar, milk and more.

loans.name: Elmer Jules

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA-TERMINAL, él banco eta ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
El socio continua dedicándose a brindar  el servicio de transporte interprovincial, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada a su negocio, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar el cambio de aceite de su carro.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the SEÑOR DE HUANCA-TERMINAL communal bank, located in the Department of Cusco. The member continues to provide inter-provincial transportation service and has been doing this for quite some time. It has been going well for him thanks to the effort he puts into his business every day. This is how he is able to help his family get ahead.

He is very grateful for the loan he has received and promises to make his payments on time. He is asking for the loan so that he can change the oil in his car.

loans.use: to change the oil in his car.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 43 years old, married and has two children. With her spouse, they manage a farming business for income and to sustain the needs of the family. One of her child stopped her studies due to financial problems. 

She wants to improve her earnings and she needs additional capital of P25,000. She is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.  Leonora will continue improving her crop production for overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming for the benefit of her family

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose, un hombre de 27 años de edad, es un individuo trabajador, emprendedor, sincero, responsable y con grandes sueños.

Solicita un crédito para iniciar su propio negocio, una pequeña empresa que iniciaría de cría y venta de aves, la iniciativa la tomo básicamente porque quiere tener un buen futuro.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de pollos de engorde, gallinas y materiales para la construcción de un galpón.

Apoyen a este empresaria que quiere demostrar que es capaz de superar sus propios límites y tener una vida plena.
texts.en:
Jose, a 27-year-old man, is a hard-working, enterprising, sincere, and responsible individual with big dreams. 

He asks for a loan to begin his own business, a small business which he would begin to grow and sell poultry. He took the initiative basically because he wants to have a good future.
