He asks for a loan to purchase chicks to fatten, hens, and materials to build a chicken coop. 

Support this businessman who wants to show he is capable of overcoming his own limits and having a full life.

loans.use: to purchase chicks to fatten, hens, and materials to build a chicken coop.

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en: A young woman from Kampong Cham province, Sokly is 23 years old and a mother of one kid. For her living, she grows cassava on four hectares area as the single main source of income. This is second cycles for Sokly with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loan completely. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide and pay for labors fee. She hopes that she can get more yields that last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay for labor fees on her cassava plantation

loans.name: Josefeen

texts.en:
Josefeen is 30 years old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. With her one son and one daughter, her children are studying. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 7 years.  He is responsible to feed the entire family and manage the house hold. 

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Nasira is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.  That way she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Josefeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his clothing business inventory

loans.name: Gulzira

texts.en:
Gulzira is an honest woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1975. She is living in the district with her family. She is divorced and lives with her parents. She has been sewing and selling Tajik women's dresses for about five years. She sews beautiful traditional dresses and has permanent customers. 

Her mother is sick and she wants to treat her at the medical clinic. She appealed to IMON asking for financial support to treat her mother at the medical clinic. She is hoping to be supported and have a healthy mother.

loans.use: to treat her mother at the medical clinic

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de multiservicios como venta de gas y fotocopiadora,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de multiservicios y venta de gas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar gas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member still has her multi-service business selling gas and making photocopies. She wants to her get family ahead with this business. Her dream is to expand the multi-service business selling gas. She is asking for the loan to buy gas. She is happy about the loan and promises to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy gas.

loans.name: Manuel Felipe

texts.es:
El  socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE II” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
El  socio Manuel  continua  trabajando para una institución pública, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar vivieres para su hogar como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the COMUZONE II communal bank. The bank is located in Huanchac district, Cusco province and Cusco department. 

The member, Manuel, continues working for a public institution. He is a responsible and persevering person. He has been in his work for a good while, which is going well for him due to the diligence he puts into his work each day, as this is the way that the member gets his family ahead.

The member asks for the loan to purchase groceries for his home such as rice, sugar, milk, and more.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for his home such as rice, sugar, milk, and more.

loans.name: Las Perlitas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAC MAKY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy ella es soltera y tiene 32 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Sumac Maky communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, which is in Cusco province and Cusco department. 

The member, Nancy, is single and is 32 years old. She works in her grocery store business. She sells basic products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. The member works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. The member has had this business for 5 years now, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. The member asks for the loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

The other members work in a business selling grains, a business selling clothing, a grocery store business, and a restaurant business. 

The member is grateful to those who form part of this dream, through this platform, and promises to make the payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Manuel Enrique

texts.es:
El  socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE II” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
El  socio Manuel  sigue trabajando para una institución pública, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar vivieres para su hogar como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the COMUZONE II communal bank. The bank is located in Huanchac district, Cusco province and Cusco department. 

The member, Manuel, continues working for a public institution. He is a responsible and persevering person. The member is grateful to those who are part of this dream and promises to make the established payments, as in this way he gets his family ahead. 

The member asks for the loan to purchase groceries for his home such as rice, sugar, milk, and more.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for his home such as rice, sugar, milk, and more.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is one of the beneficiaries of the employment program of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative.* He is married and works as a receiver and packer in a garment factory in GMA, Cavite. His work involves receiving and packing all the finished garments of the factory. Being a minimum wage earner and raising two children, Oscar's income is not enough to provide for his family, which caused him to borrow from money lenders with very high interest rates and who require them to surrender their ATMs as loan collateral. 

Therefore Oscar is asking for your financial assistance to avoid being exploited by loan sharks. He trusts that your good heart will provide him funds to repair and renovate his house to give his family a better shelter. He has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and he had no problem in repaying, since the loan payment is deducted every payday. He is thanking God and you in advance for your great help.

Oscar hopes to give his children a good life and send them to good schools to allow them better opportunities in life. He also wants to be the best receiver and packer to get a promotion and earn a higher income. He meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services. 

** CCT staff and volunteers conduct weekly fellowship meetings for the factory workers before their work routine to do Bible readings, prayer and discipleship sessions to encourage and inspire them to do their best in life.

loans.use: To pay for the renovation of his house.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 37-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four children. Her husband has been working in the public sector organization for many years and is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Shahida provides sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, and machine oil for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and will also help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services. Shahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Gulnorai

texts.ru: Гулнораи  добрая, общительная и гостеприимная девушка из района Файзабад. Ей 24 года. Она развелась с мужем, и у нее 3 летный ребенок. Гулнораи живет вместе родителям, после развода. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды. Гулнораи мастерица швеи, и услуга швеи является основным источником дохода для Гулнораи. Шить и кроить для ее доставляет много удовольствий. Она шьет платья на заказ на машинке, на которой Вы видите на фотографии. Этой машинке много лет, и она не выполняет свои функции достаточно хорошо. Гулнораи  шила на ней, потому что другой машинки у нее не было. Она хочет создать хорошие условия работы. Гулнораи  просит кредит, чтобы приобрести современную швейную машинку, и на часть оставшуюся часть денег она купить ткани и другие швейные принадлежности, чтобы расширить деятельность и увеличить доход.  Гулнораи заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Gulnorai is a kind, sociable and friendly woman from the Faizabad district. She is 24 years old. She divorced her husband and has a three year old child. Gulnorai has lived with her parents since the divorce. She sews women’s clothing and is an expert seamstress. Sewing is her main source of income and she thinks sewing and tailoring is a lot of fun. She sews dresses to order on the machine you can see in the picture. Her sewing machine is very old and does not work very well. Gulnorai uses it because she does not have another machine. She wants to create good working conditions and is requesting a loan to purchase a modern sewing machine, as well as to buy fabrics and other sewing supplies so that she can expand her business and increase her income. Gulnorai expresses her gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, fabric, and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Holbibi

texts.en:
Holbibi is a careful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1967. She is living in the district with her family and is a widow with one child. She has been working as a guard for almost six years. Her work is not easy and she has become sick. She needs to look after her child. After her husband's death she became used to finding a job and feeding her family on her own. 

She is a goal-oriented, kind and patient person. In order to continue her activity and earn money, she needs to be healthy. She asked for help from IMON and Kiva to treat herself at the medical clinic. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to treat herself at the medical clinic

loans.name: Happy Ayllu Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HAPPY AYLLU”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Katia Dina ella es soltera y tiene 31 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo y los fotos son de uno de los prestamos anteriores. 
Se pega a mas de 4 personas porque los socios no asisten a la misma hora de la reunion porque no le das permiso en su trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de sabanas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de productos de belleza.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Happy Ayllu", located in the Wanchaq district, in the province and department of Cusco.  

Katia Dina is single, 31 years old, and has one child.  She has a business selling cereals.  She sells corn, wheat and quinoa, working from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm.  She already has a few years in this business and it is going very well.  Her dream is to have a location where she could sell her cereals.  She is requesting a loan to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.  

The members who are in the thumbnail photos asked permission to do so for work-related reasons, and the photos are from previous loans.  These four members could not attend the meeting at the time of the photo due to their work.

The other members work selling clothing, selling bedsheets, and have grocery store and beauty product businesses.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Yeni Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA-TERMINAL, él banco eta ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia  Yeni Roxana continua  trabajando en una empresa privada de transporte interprovincial, la socia lleva buen tiempo en su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para pagar los estudios de su hijo y víveres para su hogar.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Señor de Huanca-Terminal communal bank. The bank is located in Cusco department. 

The member, Yeni Roxana, continues working in a private inter-provincial transportation business. She has been at her job for a good while, which is going well for her, thanks to the diligence that she puts into her business each day. She wants to be able to continue working so that, in this way, to continue supporting her family. 

The member is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments.

The member asks for the loan to pay for her child's education and groceries for her home.

loans.use: to pay for her child's education and groceries for her home.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito de Huanchac departamento de Cusco.
La socia MARIA  continua trabajando en una empresa pública, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de un electrodoméstico para su hogar.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the COMUZONE II communal bank. The bank is located in Huanchac district, Cusco province and Cusco department. 

The member, María, continues working in a public business. She has been at her job for a good while, which is going well for her due to the diligence that she puts into her business each day. She wants to be able to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family. 

The member is grateful for and values the support offered through this platform and promises to make the payments on her debt on the established schedule.

The member asked for the loan to purchase an appliance for her home.

loans.use: to purchase an appliance for her home.

loans.name: Licenia

texts.es:
Licenia, en su mente lo único que tiene presente es que para salir adelante hay que trabajar duramente y mantenerse siempre fuerte ante las adversidades que se puedan presentar.

Por esta razón, todos los días labora de una manera firme pero sin dejar a un lado su gran sonrisa y carisma que le han permitido ganarse un lugar desde hace 5 años cuando decidió iniciar con un negocio de fabricación de tableros acrílicos para niños.

Es un negocio único y poco común en su ciudad y es por esto que lo hace con todo el empeño posible.

Pide un apoyo económico para la compra de materiales como madera, pintura acrílica y marcos, con los que podrá mejorar su capital de trabajo y aumentar su producción de tableros.

Ella sabe que de la mano de interactuar y con el apoyo de los prestamistas de KIVA podrá tener un negocio muy bien acreditado y con la mejor estabilidad posible.
texts.en:
For Licenia, the foremost thought in her mind is that in order to get ahead, she must work hard and always stay strong in the face of any adversities that may arise. 

For this reason, she works determinedly every day, but she still maintains her big smile and her charisma, which have allowed her to make a name for herself since she decided five years ago to start a business making whiteboards for children. 

It is a unique business, uncommon in her city, and for this reason she is carrying it out with all possible dedication. 

She is requesting economic support to buy materials such as wood, acrylic paint and frames. This will allow her to increase her working capital and expand her production of boards. 

She knows that thanks to Interactuar and with the support of the Kiva lenders, she will be able to have a well-equipped business with the greatest possible stability.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood, acrylic paint and frames to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 52 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Ethel works very hard to provide for them.

Ethel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, milk, and drinks.

Ethel has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, milk, and drinks

loans.name: Hedelisa

texts.en:
Hedelisa is 39 years old and has three children. Hedelisa is married and has four children who are presently in school.

Hedelisa is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Hedelisa requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Hedelisa has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en: Rizwana is a 52-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons and two daughters. Her children are in school. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for seven years, and is the only person responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Rizwana is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn the maximum profit with the help of this loan. Rizwana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her husband to increase his clothing business

loans.name: Edith Rocio

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA-TERMINAL, él banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua  dedicándose a trabajar en una empresa privada de transporte interprovincial, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el cambio de aceite de su carro.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Señor de Huanca-Terminal communal bank. The bank is located in Cusco department.

The member continues working at a private inter-provincial transportation business. She has been in her business for a good while, which is going well for her, thanks to the diligence which she puts into her business each day. She wants to be able to continue working so that, in this way, she can continue supporting her family.

The member asks for a loan to change the oil in her car.

loans.use: to change the oil in her car.

loans.name: Maritza Monserrate

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente en Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y variedad de platos típicos de la región.
En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 8 y 6 años que estudian en una escuela de la localidad. El marido se dedica  a la pesca. 
Doña Maritza es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta realizar sus propias actividades y así sentirse independiente, ella tiene un local en el cual vende comida rápida, son muchos los clientes que todas las tardes llegan a servirse hamburguesas, papas fritas,  chuzos, alitas de pollo con plátano asado entre otros, ella  también en las mañanas se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo lo cual lo hace puerta a puerta y también en su local, lleva más de 5 años dedicada a estas actividades con lo cual se gana lo suyo que le ayuda a salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar carne, embutidos, pollo y ropa de todo tipo. Lleva más 7 años en el grupo de crédito  y le gusta  por los beneficios que ofrece la institución como la atención médica gratuita. Sus sueños es que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en: In the seaside resort of San Clemente in Portoviejo, the "1 de Diciembre" communal bank meets every fifteen days. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, which are popular with many domestic and international tourists. It offers a diversity of beautiful places and a rich variety of traditional regional dishes. In this location lives Maritza. She is 29 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which she has two children, who are 8 and 6 years old and study at the local school. Her husband makes his living in fishing. Maritza is a very hard-working woman who likes to carry out her own activities and thus feel independent. She has a site where she sells fast food. There are many customers who come every night to be served hamburgers, french fries, "chuzos" (meat skewers), and chicken wings with roasted plantains, among other items. Also, in the mornings, she makes a living selling all kinds of clothing door-to-door and also at a local site. She has dedicated more than 5 years to these activities and earned strengths which will help her succeed. This loan is going to be used to buy meat, sausages, chicken, and clothing of all kinds. She has over 7 years in the credit group and likes the benefits offered by the group such as free medical care. Her dream is that her children get a good education.

loans.use: to buy meat, sausages, chicken, and clothing.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna works hard to support her family. Myrna is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Myrna has been in this business for four years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Roydal

texts.en:
Roydal is a 31-year-old married woman who has one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Roydal has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Roydal requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in the market.

Roydal has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is 35 years old and married.

Jelly is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Jelly requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jelly has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jennifer is 43 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Jennifer has a buying and selling of personal products business in the Philippines. Jennifer requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional items of personal products to sell to her customers.

Jennifer has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items of personal products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past 15 years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
María, de 70 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, es viuda y tiene 6 hijos, quienes se han formalizado y tienen sus propios hogares, con ella solo vive una nieta de 15 años de edad.

María, ha trabajado desde pequeña, ya que sus padres fueron agricultores y realizaban cultivos de maíz, frijol y sorgo. Desde muy temprana edad, aprendió esta actividad, y aun continúa realizándola.- Actualmente siembra maíz y frijol, y para esto recibe ayuda de dos de sus hijos y sus nietos. El lugar donde cultiva esta aproximadamente a 1 kilómetro de su casa, y el recorrido lo realiza a pie.

El crédito será invertido para comprar insumos agrícolas, de esta forma podrá realizar la siembra de cultivo de maíz.

María, sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
María, 70 years old, went to school up to the third grade, is a widow, and has 6 children, who have grown up and have their own homes. Only a 15-year-old granddaughter lives with her. 

María has been working since she was little, since her parents were farmers and they grew corn, beans, and sorghum crops. From a very early age, she learned this work, and she is still doing it. Currently, she grows corn and beans and for this she has the help of two of her children and her grandchildren. The place where she has her crops is approximately 1 kilometer from her house and she goes there on foot. 

The loan will be invested in the purchase of agricultural supplies, in this way she will plant a crop of corn. 

María dreams of improving her house.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Aida Leonor

texts.es: Leonor  es una señora de 32 años de edad, Leonor esta casada y su esposo se dedica al jornal, Leonor tiene una hija de 13 años y un hijo de 8 años. Leonor y su esposa se dedican a la agricultura y al jornal de trabajos en el campo. Leonor solicita el dinero del crédito para compra semilla de alverja, pagar del arriendo del terreno en el que va a sembrar. Leonor ya tiene cultivos y  va a sembrar otro huerto. Leonor tiene la aspiración de seguir trabajando pero todo lo hace para bienestar de sus hijos, Leonor cometa que el trabajo en el campo es duro y por este motivo les gustaría que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y a futuro  lleguen a tener un buen trabajo.
texts.en: Leonor is a 32-year-old woman. Leonor is married and her husband is a day laborer. Leonor has a 13-year-old daughter and an 8-year-old son. Leonor and her husband work in agriculture and day labor in the country side. Leonor asks for the loan to purchase pea seeds and pay the rent for the land where she will plant. Leonor already has crops and will plant another field. Leonor has the aspiration to continue working but she does all she can for her children's well-being. Leonor says that the work of the countryside is hard and for this reason she would like that her children finish their education and in the future have a good job.

loans.use: to purchase pea seeds.

loans.name: Nhom 10 - Luu Phuong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Co, pictured first from the left, is 34 years old, and has four children who are all in school. She and her husband do not have stable jobs, earning about VND 600,000 ($28) monthly. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2009. Currently, her household does not have a hygienic latrine. With this $381 loan, she will have a hygienic toilet installed in her home. This loan will help Co and the other four members of Nhom 10 - Luu Phuong to build a septic tank and a hand-washing device with soap to improve living conditions, safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

With the help of local Women Union in this campaign, Thrive Network can ensure the repayment rate up to 99%.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Justo es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está en pareja y tiene 3 hijos, por quienes el está luchando duro cada día para poder sacarlos adelante y darles una digna calidad de vida.
Se dedica a la construcción de obras, y por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para ayudar a sus seres queridos, algún día quiere poder ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales para que no pasen por trabajos duros.
Pide este préstamo para poder refaccionar su casa y dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Justo is from the city of Encarnación. He is partnered and has 3 children, for whom he is fighting hard each day to be able to get them ahead and give them a dignified quality of life. 

He works in construction, and through his work he has the means to help his loved ones. One day, he wants to be able to see his children become professionals so that they don't have to do hard work. 

He asks for this loan to be able to renovate his house and give his children a batter quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en: Ruzanna is a clever girl. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1989. She is living in a small town with her parents. She is single and studies at University. Her major is management and she is one of the active students among the students. She is well known among coursemates and neighbors as a good and kind girl. She studies hard in order to get a higher education and graduate with excellence. She appealed to IMON asking for financial support for her higher education costs. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to pay her higher education cost

loans.name: Alba Fabiola

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus hermosas playas, por su rica y variada gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo  De Crédito Cien Por Ciento Banco.
En este lugar vive la señora Alba, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos mayores de edad e independientes. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Alba se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de  Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale en sus ratos libres sobretodo en horas de la mañana ya que a esa hora es más fresco, ella  también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva más de 8 años con esta actividad que le permite ganar sus propios ingresos y sentirse independiente.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar  ropa de todo tipo, cremas y perfumes. Lleva 2 ciclos en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos se ayudan para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener un local.
texts.en:
In the city of Bahía de Caraquez, known for its lovely beaches, for its rich and varied cuisines, and for the warmth of its people, the members of the Cien por Ciento communal bank group meet every two weeks. 

Alba lives in this place. She is 44 years old and is in a common-law marriage, from which she has two adult and independent children. Her husband is a businessman. 

Alba works selling clothing and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories). She sells from door to door, she goes out in her free time, particularly in the morning house since at this time it is cooler. She also sells in her house where her most well-known customers come. She leaves the items on credit and collects weekly. She has had this business for more than 8 years, which allows her go earn her own income and feel independent.  

This loan will be used to purchase all sorts of clothing, creams, and perfumes. She has been in the loan group for two loan cycles and she likes it because, with the loans, they help each other get ahead. Her dream is to have a retail space.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, creams, and perfumes.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 60 years old and single. Teresita works very hard to provide for her family.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, and drinks.

Teresita has been in this business for eight years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, and drinks

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 49 years old and has four children. Marites is married and has two children who are still in school.

Marites is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marites has been in this business for five years, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Erika Lorena

texts.es: A sus 22 años de edad Lorena vive con sus padres y sus hermanos. Lorena hace 3 años que salió del colegio y desde ese momento tuvo que salir a trabajar al jornal y también siembra papas a medias con su padre. Lorena desea obtener el crédito para comprar abono y fungicidas y mano de obra que a veces se necesita para trabajar en sus cultivos. Lorena tiene la aspiración de seguir trabajando para mejorar su negocio y de ser posible mas adelante inscribirse a la universidad.
texts.en:
At her 22 years of age Lorena lives with her parents and her siblings.  Lorena left school 3 years ago and from that moment on she has had to go out to work as a day laborer and also she plants potatoes part-time with her father.  Lorena wants to obtain the loan to purchase fertilizer and fungicide and labor that is sometimes needed to work on their crops.  

Lorena aspires to continue working to improve her business and for it to be possible in the future to enroll in college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and fungicide.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 52 years old and married with eight children. With four children still in school, Mylene works very hard to provide for them.

Mylene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Mylene has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shirts, jeans, t-shirts and other types of clothing.

loans.name: Edita María

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente en Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.
En este lugar vive la señora Edita, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es maestro constructor.
Doña Edita es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para cubrir los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y zapatos por catalogo, ella sale a vender por la localidad en días que no está ocupada y también vende en su casa.  Los fines de semana  y feriados  prepara desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas, en su restaurante trabaja con la ayuda de su hijo. Tiene más de 10 años con su restaurante y hace poco empezó con el negocio de ropa y zapatos con lo cual mejora sus ingresos.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar ropa, zapatos, arroz, carne, pescado, frutas y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por los servicios médicos que ofrece la institución. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
In the seaside resort town of San Clemente in Portoviejo, the "1 de Diciembre" communal bank meets every fifteen days.  This area is known for its beautiful beaches, which are frequented by many national and international tourists.  It offers a diversity of beautiful locations and a rich variety of traditional regional foods.

Edita lives in this place.  She is 53 years old, married, and has three adult children, one of whom still lives with her.  Her husband is a master builder.  She is very much a fighter and likes to work to cover the household expenses.  She works selling clothing and shoes by catalog.   She sells them throughout the town on days when she is not very busy and also sells from her home.  On the weekends and holidays she makes breakfast, lunch and snacks in her restaurant with the help of her son.  She has had her restaurant for more than 10 years and recently started the business of selling clothing and shoes, which has helped her income.

This loan will be used to buy clothing, shoes, rice, meat, fish, fruit, and other food supplies.  She has been with the communal bank since it started and likes the medical services the institution offers.  She has dreams of continuing to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, rice, meat, fish, fruit, and other goods.

loans.name: Jetypeka Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Jetypeka está en su ciclo número  8º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Liliana es una de las integrantes de este grupo, es la presidenta del grupo, una mujer muy luchadora que está saliendo adelante por medio de  su luchad diaria en la venta de frutas y verduras que hace. Comenta que ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compran de ella los buenos productos que vende.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, frutas frescas para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su vida
texts.en:
The group called Jetypeka is in its 8th loan cycle in the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other get ahead. They are completing the poverty elimination tool, where each one is putting her best effort into being able to grow and get ahead.

Liliana is one of the members of this group. She is the president of the group, a very determined woman who is getting ahead through her daily struggle that she does selling fruits and vegetables. She says that she already has a good customer base which always purchases the good products that she sells.

She asks for this loan to purchase fresh vegetables and fruit to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a water refilling business in the Philippines.

Luisa requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more water containers to sell.

Luisa has been in this business for four years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more water containers to sell

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is a 54-year-old married woman with one child, who is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Janice has an auto repair shop business in the Philippines. 

Janice requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional spare parts and maintenance for her business.

Janice has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza works hard to support her family. Liza is single with one child and has a furniture business in the Philippines.

Liza requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bamboo and materials for her business.

Liza has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo and materials for her business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 47 years old and married with three children.

Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, drinks, milk, coffee, etc.

Mary Ann has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Mary Ann aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, drinks, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Eizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman  with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are water and food.

She has operated a business of supplying construction materials to the community. She mentioned seasonality and transportation as major challenges in her place of operation.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more materials for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access a loan and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for resale.

loans.name: Narom

texts.en:
A mother of six children living in Kampong Cham province, Narom is 48 years old. To struggle with her family’s hardship, she earns an income via rice farming and working for others for a fee to earn more income. 

This is her fourth cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. She will spend her loan portion to buy a decent motorbike. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.en: Gulandom is a skillful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1972. She is living in a village where the conditions for doing business in agriculture are good. She is married and has five children. In order to feed her big family, she and her husband are working hard. Her first business was trading grocery products. For almost seven years, she has worked in agriculture, planting wheat, watermelons, melons, onions, etc. She is planning to get a good harvest next season. She is asking for financial support from Kiva and IMON to buy seeds and fertilizer. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en: Muhabbat is a bright woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1977. She is living in the district with her family. She is single and works at a school. She teaches the Uzbek language to the initial class. She is a responsible, talented and patient person. She has many years of experience and knows her duty well. Her mother is old and she is sick. Muhabbat wants to treat her mother and asked for help from IMON and Kiva to support her mother in the hard time of her life. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to treat her mother.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.en: Abdurahim is an anxious man. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in a family of workers. He is married and has four children. He has 26 years of experience working as a teacher. He is a teacher in secondary school and is well known among teachers and students. He likes his profession because he helps to educate pupils. His grandson is sick and gets treatment in the hospital. Abdurahim is asking for financial support from IMON and Kiva to buy medicines and pay for a surgical operation for his grandson. He hopes to be supported and that his grandson gets better.

loans.use: to buy medicines and pay for a surgical operation for his grandson.

loans.name: Mirzosharif

texts.en: Mirzosharif is an honest man. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1990. He is living in the district with his family. He is married and has two children. He has a year of practice working as a teacher in a secondary school. Then, he became a worker at a micro deposit organization. He works hard in order to take care of his family and help his parents. His brother is ill and needs to be treated. Mirzosharif is planning to pay for treatment of his brother in the hospital. He is asking for financial support from Kiva and IMON. He awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to pay for the treatment of his brother in the hospital.

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.en: Sanavbar is a bright woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1993. She is living in the district with her family. She is married and her husband is an emigrant. She is a goal-oriented, responsible and patient person. She is a student at a medical institute. Additionally she works at an AID organization. She has a dream to continue her studies and get higher education. She appealed to IMON, asking for financial support to pay her higher education costs. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness and hopes to get a higher education.

loans.use: to pay her higher education costs.

loans.name: That

texts.en:
That, 34, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are in school and other one is too young. She can earn income to support her family’s living via rice cropping and cassava growing. 

This is her eighth cycle for That with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and cassava seed. She hopes that she can get more income to upgrade her condition and support on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cassava seeds for improved crop yield

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Siradie's Group

texts.fr: Siradie qui se trouve sur la photo au centre, portant une daba sur l’épaule droite, est membre d’un groupe de 13 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Kimi au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Siradie, âgée de 64 ans, est la mère de 7 enfants âgés de 16 à 30 ans, et dont l'un d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Siradie à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 50 ans. Siradie cultive l'arachide, le mais, le mil, le riz, le maraichage, l'haricot sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque terre cultivables. Siradie entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison des semences de qualité et de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Siradie effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 50 ans que Siradie cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Enfin Siradie espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Siradie is at the centre in the photo, wearing a daba over her right shoulder. She is a member of a group of 13 farmers who have partnered with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Kimi, southeast of Bamako in Mali. 

Siradie, 64 years old, is a mother to seven children ages 16 to 30, one of them currently in school. Her family's long-standing tradition in farming as the main source of revenue and food self-sufficiency for the household is why Siradie started farming 50 years ago. 

Siradie grows groundnuts, maize, millet, rice, beans, fruits and vegetables on her plot, but she face challenges such as the lack of farmable land. This is her first year with myAgro; she signed up because of the quality of the seeds and the potential to bolster her productivity through the services available. This year, Siradie is buying one myAgro packet of OPV seeds and fertilizers to grow groundnuts and increase the yield on her .0625-hectare holding. 
It has now been 50 years since Siradie started growing groundnuts for its value as a staple food because it is directly edible by the family, and it is used as a base sauce in cooking; it is also a profitable crop that she sells at the market.  

Siradie hopes to be able to achieve self-sufficiency with respect to her family’s food requirements.

loans.use: to buy a packet of OPV seeds and fertilizers to grow groundnuts.

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province, Savorn is 31 years old. She is the mother of two children, one of whom is in school and other one is too young. Because of her living condition, she can earn income via cassava growing and rice farming. 

For Savorn, this is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. She will spend her loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can get more income to expand her farmland bigger than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide for her cassava crop and pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells goods like biscuits, noodles, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil and toiletries.  She is a married woman with three children who are between the ages of 18 and 22 years old. She has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store for more than 10 years.  Aside from operating a sari-sari (variety) store, she manages a tricycle transport service. 

She  is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, beverages, groceries and a pig. These resources will enable her store to attract more buyers and also she could start raising hogs. Her income will improve and she will be able to handle her finances. With these, she could now provide her family with nutritious diets and better living conditions. 

In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beverages, groceries and a pig.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
For almost 11 years now, Rosalina has engaged in fishing. She sells fish to earn a living. She is a 56 year old married woman with six children from Bien Unido, Bohol. Her youngest child is 14 year old.  Aside from fishing , she also engages in buying and selling of crabs. Her husband is a fisherman. 

She  is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like  fishing nets, weights, floaters and fuel for the motorboat. These tool will boost its fishing livelihood and able to improve the on going catch. Thus, she could now be able to provide her family with nutritious meals and be able to continue financing the schooling of her children.

Rosalina hopes to expand her both sources of income to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like  fishing nets, weights, floaters and fuel for the motorboat

loans.name: Thanh Yen 8 Group

texts.en:
Phuong is single mom who lives in a small house with her only daughter. She is 41 years old and illiterate. Because of lack of knowledge and skill, she only has a very few production activities, which are cultivating rice and breeding chickens. To provide better for her daughter who studies at grade 9, she takes great effort to increase production. For that reason, she has taken a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to have capital for investment. This is the fourth time she has received a loan from the program and she will use it to buy chickens and food for the them. She hopes that the chickens will not catch disease and that they will bring good income so that she can provide better for her child. 

Phuong dreams that her daughter will enter a good college, then get a good job and have a brighter future. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy chickens and food for the them.

loans.name: Walter Vladimir

texts.es: Walter tiene 29 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su madre que es una persona de la tercera edad a la que apoya con mucho gusto ya que es una persona responsable. El aprendió el oficio de la serigrafía hace mucho tiempo y es gracias a ello que se gana la vida desde hace 3 años. Walter desea realizar la conexión de aguas negras, ya que actualmente no cuenta con este servicio, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tubos, grava, cemento y hierro para realizar la conexión de aguas negras en su vivienda, ya que desea mejorar la sanidad de su hogar y evitar cualquier contaminación.
texts.en:
Walter is 29 years old and owns the home where he lives with his mother, who is an elderly woman that he supports with great pleasure, because he is a responsible person.

He learned the craft of screen-printing a long time ago and through this work he has been earning a living for the last 3 years.

Walter wants to connect his house to a sewage system, a service they do not currently have. 

For this reason he is requesting a FUSAI loan to buy the pipes, gravel, cement and iron needed to connect his home to the sewage system, because he wants to improve sanitary conditions in his home and avoid any type of contamination.

loans.use: to buy the pipes, gravel, cement and iron needed to connect his home to the sewage system

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina MUJERES UNIDAS, es un grupo nuevo con quince integrantes, todas están muy confiadas y entusiasmadas por el programa de Comités de Mujeres.
Entre ellas se destaca la señora Celia, por su entusiasmo y dedicación, se desempeña como comerciante, vende ropas desde su casa y también fabrica productos de limpieza, diversificando de esa manera sus ingresos y dándole una mejor calidad de vida a sus seres queridos.
Ella comenta que todo lo que hace es por un mejor futuro de su familia, para que de esa forma mejoren cada día. Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas varias para la venta, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Unidas" is a new group with 15 members, who are all very confident and excited for the "Comités de Mujeres" (Women's Communal Banks) program.  

Featured among them is Celia, for her enthusiasm and dedication.  She works as a salesperson, selling clothing out of her home.  She also makes cleaning products, which diversifies her income to give a better quality of life to her family.  She comments that everything she does is for a better future for her family, and in this way they improve every day.  

She is requesting this loan to buy a variety of clothing to sell, which will allow her to continue with her sales as they come in.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre SANTA ANA, es un grupo antiguo y numeroso, se encuentran con 20 integrantes, son de la ciudad de Santaní, todas ellas se dedican a actividades rurales, donde ponen su esfuerzo por poder crecer no solo en el trabajo que cada una hace, sino también ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Entre ellas se destaca la señora Mariza, por su espíritu emprendedor, trabaja desde su propia casa, cuenta con una pequeña mercería, ofreciendo ropas para bebés, chicos y grandes. Tiene una buena clientela siempre, ya que ella es una persona muy jovial que atiende a todos de una excelente manera. Ella se unió para poder luchar y mejorar cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias, artículos de bazar y otros productos para poder surtir su negocio y cada día con ello poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
This communal bank is named Santa Ana. It is a longstanding and numerous group, currently with 20 members. All of them dedicate themselves to rural activities, where they make an effort in order to grow, not only in the work that each one of them does, but also in helping one another. 

Among them is Mariza, who stands out for her enterprising spirit. She works from her home and has a small notions store, where she offers clothes for babies and children. She always has a good clientele, since she is a very jovial person who provides excellent service to everyone. She joined the group in order to keep working hard and improving every day. 

She is requesting this loan in order to buy a variety of garments, household items and other products to stock her store, so that each day she can keep growing and improving.

loans.use: to buy a variety of garments, household items and other products to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married with five children and a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. Teresita support the family through her farming rice business in the Philippines.

She took an educational loan for her daughter Julie Ann, 15 years old and is 3rd of 5 children in the family, who is studying Bachelor of Science in Information Technology and is currently in the 1st of this 4 year course.

Teresita is borrowing 12,500 to pay for tuition fees of her daughter Julie Ann for the First Semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Julie Ann plans when she graduates to help her parents earn an income to send her brother and sister in college.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees for a BSc in IT

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is a 28 year old woman, who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 2 children. Her husband has been working in the public sector organization for many years.  He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family.  

Riffat is providing sewing services and earns an income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 
She needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Riffat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy needles, thread, cloth etc  to increase her tailoring business and have a better profit

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La Sra. Graciela es de la ciudad de Itá, tiene un hijo y una hija, se dedica a la faena de animales en forma independiente, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante para mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
Graciela es una persona muy trabajadora que poco a poco y con mucho sacrificio se ha abierto camino y hoy día con ello mantiene y ayuda a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar animales para la faena, y con ello poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Graciela is from the city of Itá. She has one son and one daughter, and she works raising animals as an independent business. She is a very hard-working and determined woman who wants to get ahead in order to improve her life and that of her family. 

Graciela is a very hard-working person who has made a path for herself, little by little and with great sacrifice, and today she is able to support and help her family with it. 

She is requesting this loan in order to buy animals to raise, With this, she will be able to continue her work as she has been doing, in order to help her family.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Miguel está integrado por 18 mujeres, cada una de ellas está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias. Quieren un mejor porvenir para las personas que ella quiere.
Liliana es una de estas mujeres, una persona muy luchadora, que cada día empieza su día a día, se levanta muy temprano para poder hacer las comidas que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Las comidas que hace son muy ricas, y es por ello que tiene muchos clientes que siempre compran de ella.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser carne, verduras, condimentos, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir haciendo su negocio. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
This group, called San Miguel, is made up of 18 women. Each one of them is putting in her best effort to improve her situation in life and that of her family. They want a better future for the people they love. 

Liliana is one of these women, a very hard-working person who begins each day by getting up very early to make food which she later goes out to sell as a mobile vendor. The food she makes is very delicious, and for this reason she has many customers who always buy from her. 

She is requesting this loan in order to buy ingredients to make her food, such as meat, vegetables, condiments, bread, and other items, so that she can continue operating her business. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to improve day by day.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, bread and other ingredients to make food to sell.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carmela is 51 years old and has one child in school.

Carmela has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Carmela has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Carmela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Sarafeen

texts.en:
Sarafeen is 37 year old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children and her husband owns a printing shop.  He is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the need of all family members. 

Sarafeen has been running her own beauty saloon for the past 6 years.  She also contributes her income with her husband to manage the house hold. 
She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brushes and other accessories for her beauty saloon, but due to financial constraints she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore Sarafeen has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.  Sarafeen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her beauty parlor business with new hairbrushes and cosmetics

loans.name: Syna's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kratie province, Syna is 34 years old. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is too young to attend school and other two are in school. 

For her living, she grows cassava as the main source of her income and sells the grocery items to earn extra income. This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully.  In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees to support her farm. She hopes that she can get more yields than last year.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees on her cassava farm

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en: Navy is ages 45 years old, a rural villager living in Mondulkiri province. She is a mother of three children and only one of them is in school. The sources of her family’s income are from cassava farming and make-up materials selling for three years. She is now leading a group of two to take a new loan via VisionFund to pay for plowing fees. She hopes to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees on her cassava farm

loans.name: Mosoq Paqariy Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOQ PAQARIY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quellouno, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Beatriz la socia tiene 38 años de edad tiene 04 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su negocio de restaurante la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz,aceite entre otros.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado  y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the communal bank "MOSOQ PAQARIY", which is located in the Quellouno district, belonging to La Convención province and the Cusco department.

Beatriz is 38-years-old, has 4 children, and is single. She alternates her daily activities, dedicating time to her restaurant business. She is a responsible and tenacious person, who has been running her business for a good while. It is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.

She wants to continue working in order to keep earning a living for her family. Beatriz is requesting a loan to buy rice, cooking oil, and other supplies.  

The borrowers are grateful for the loans offered and commit to making their payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, and other supplies

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is operating a store and direct selling business for income. She is 43 years old and has two children attending school. She wants to improve her profits to continue providing educational needs of her children. She is now asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, and biscuits to sell. She will also revolve her profits in direct-selling business for additional revenues. 

Marilou will be happy to see her children become professionals in their chosen career someday.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, eggs and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Sreymai's Group

texts.en: Sreymai, 35, is a mother of a small child, living in Mondulkiri province. Grocery seller is the main source of her family’s income for five years. Due to a lack of funds, she is now applying for a new loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, to buy more grocery items for sale. She hopes this loan will help her family to have a better living condition.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for sale

loans.name: Sivan's Group

texts.en:
Sivan, 33, is a mother of three children and only two of them are in school, living in Kratie province. Growing cassava on five hectares farmland and working for other farms for a fee are the sources of her family’s income for six years. She could earn about 77,700KHR per day. 

Now she lacks funds to pay for plowing fees, so she decided to take a Kiva loan to fulfill her needs. She hopes to earn more income to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees to increase her family's living standard

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 49 years old and has seven children. Edna is married and has four children are currently in school.

Edna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Edna has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 35 years old woman, and mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is milk seller by profession and sells milk and yoghurt. Her husband is responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Rehana's husband needs to purchase milk for reselling purpose so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase milk for his business purpose.

Therefore Rehana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purpose. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his milk business by purchasing more milk

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa se formó con la unión de varias amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, son 17 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que quieren salir adelante.
Entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Jorgelina, una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que se dedica a la venta de ropas variadas, es una mujer muy luchadora que poco a poco se ha abierto camino. Comenta que quiere poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo, es por eso que está poniendo todo de sí.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, como ser jeans, camisas, remeras, pantalones y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas y ayudar así a su familia.
texts.en:
El group named Kuña Guapa was formed by a few friends and neighbours in the city of Villa Elisa. They are 17 very hard-working women who want to get ahead.

Among them Mrs. Jorgelina stands out, a very hard-working person who makes a living selling varied clothing. She is a striver who little by little has made her way in life. She comments that she wants to help her family through her work. It is because of this that she is giving it her all.

She is requesting this loan to buy varied clothing to sell, such as jeans, shirts, t-shirts, pants and others, so as to increase her sales and help her family.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, t-shirts, pants and other clothing to sell

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn works hard to support her family. Erlyn is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Erlyn requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, flour, cooking oil, utensils and other materials for her food production business.

Erlyn has been in this business for 1 year now, and also earns additional income from buy and sell fruits and a general store.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, flour, cooking oil, utensils and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Yoeun's Group

texts.en: Yoeun, 38, is a mother of six children and two of them are in school, living in Kratie province. Growing cassava on one hectare farmland and working on other farm for fee are the sources of her family’s income for thirteen years. She could earn about 54,000KHR daily to support her family’s living. Due to a lack of funds, she is now leading a group of three to take a new loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farming. She hopes to increase her incomes and ability to support her children’s studying through this loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her cassava farm to increase yield

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Alegres  está en su ciclo número 3, están también dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas y cada una de ellas quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Myrian quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta en una cantina que tiene, está teniendo los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, frutas, golosinas y otros para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Alegres" group is in their 3rd loan cycle.  They are also part of the poverty eradication program and each of the women wish to improve their quality of life and that of their families.

One of the members is Myrian who in her last survey reported a poverty level of three, which is to say that through her effort and continuous work, and through the sales from her snack bar, she has the means to be able to help her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy drinks, food, fruit, candy, and other items to be able to continue with her sales as they come in.  She appreciates the opportunity she is receiving to be able to improve every day and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy drinks, food, fruit, candy and other items.

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Divino Niño” esta dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, integrado por 19 mujeres, que a través de su esfuerzo, sumado a las capacitaciones quiere poder mejorar para poder dar una vida digna a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Martina, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que está en una situación de pobreza extrema. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, y tiene todo tipo que siempre ofrece a sus clientes. Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante y es por ello que pone su mayor esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas, como ser camisas, remeras, pantalones, blusas, jeans y otros para poder seguir con sus ventas. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The "Divino Niño" group is part of a poverty elimination program. It is composed of 19 women who through their effort and training want to improve their families' lives. 

One of the group members is Martina. In her survey, she was classified as being in poverty level 1, which means she lives in extreme poverty. She sells all kinds of clothing items for a living. She is a hardworking and tenacious person that wants to get ahead in life.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of clothing items, such as shirts, t-shirts, pants, blouses, jeans, etc. to continue with her sales. She thanks the lenders for the opportunity to be able to continue selling clothes as she has been doing until now.

loans.use: to buy shirts, t-shirts, pants, blouses, jeans and other clothing items for sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial, ella comenta que pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y ser un buen profesional el día de mañana.
