Ella es una persona que quiere ser alguien en la vida y por ello lucha y pone todo lo mejor de sí. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of San Ignacio and is studying a major in Commercial Engineering. She comments that she does her best to be able to grow and to become a good professional in the future.

She is a person who wants to do something with her life. Because of this, she strives and gives it her all. She requests this loan to be able to pay her tuition fees and so to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.en:
Sanavbar is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1959. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. She started to do business from working seasonally helping agrarians. With the aim of having better standard of living, she decided to have her own business. Now she is an agrarian and plants cereals and vegetables in her land. 

Sanavbar wants to get a loan to buy fertilizer and cultivate her land. She hopes IMON and Kiva will support her in doing business and getting a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cultivate her land

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria ella es soltera y tiene 37 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de ganaderia, la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ganados, negocio de venta de fruta, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “Las Emprendedoras de Andahuaylillas” communal bank. The bank is located in the Andahuaylillas district of the Quispicanchis province in the department of Cusco. 

Sra. Victoria is a member. She is 37 years old and single and she has two children. She works in her livestock business. She fattens the livestock and helps them grow, and then sells them at the various markets. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. 

By working at this she hopes to get ahead. This member’s dream is to grow her business of livestock sales. She is seeking the loan to buy one cow.

The other members are involved in sales of livestock, a fruit selling business, a small grocery shop and a restaurant business.

The member thanks those who are part of this dream through this site, and she promises to make her payments within the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
For 29 years, Evangeline has been selling vegetables in their community in Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is 42 years of age right now and is married to Hasson, who works abroad. Providing for the needs of the family, they both do work with determination and passion. 

Evangeline wants to improve her business. She wants to have her own stall someday. For now, nothing is more important to her than earning a bigger profit. Because of this, she would like to avail a loan worth PHP 12000 that she will use to purchase more vegetable stocks to sell. This amount will surely be a good head-start for her dream of expansion. 

She prays today to have more strength and blessings for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetable stocks to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Esther operates a vegetables selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Tessie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell in the market.

Tessie has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
El Sr. Cristian es taxista, comenta que se dedica a su trabajo desde hace 5 años, es una persona muy trabajadora que se está esforzando mucho para poder salir adelante y crecer.
El comenta que por medio de su trabajo se ha abierto camino y cada día quiere seguir mejorando. Pide este préstamo para poder reparar su taxi y así seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Cristián is a taxi driver.  He said he has earned a living in this line of work for five years.  He's a very hardworking person who's making an effort to be able to get ahead and grow.  He said his work has paved the way for him and he wants to keep improving every day.

Cristián's requesting this loan so he can repair his taxi and keep providing his customers with good service.

He's grateful for this opportunity to be able to grow and get ahead.

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 24-year-old single man who opened a clothes shop five years ago to help cover his family's needs and expenses. He is a hard worker and ambitious man who has a good reputation among his customers.

Ahmad is trying desperately to develop his business, thus today he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with a new collection of summer clothes to satisfy his customers' needs. Ahmad hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and stay capable of providing his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with a new collection of summer clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase flower, milk, eggs, herbs, etc. to be able to stock her store.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is a 46-year-old married mother of four children. She decided nine years ago to start embroidering from her house to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. Safaa learned embroidering from her mother since her childhood which helped her in gaining professional and creative skills. 

Today, Safaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business through buying necessary embroidery tools and materials (needle, pricker, thread, metal strips, pearls, beads, etc..) which will help her in providing her customers with unique designs.

Safaa hopes to expand her business more in the future through opening her own shop to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy embroidery tools and materials (needle, pricker, thread, metal strips, pearls, beads, etc..)

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.en: Mukaram is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1967. She is living in a small town with her family. She is a widow and has three children. For two years she has been keeping livestock and trading them in the domestic market. She works hard to feed her family. She alone  raises and supports her children. For a long period she did not rest, that is why she became sick. Now she needs to be treated in a medical clinic. She is requesting financial support from Kiva and IMON to be treated at a medical clinic. She hopes to be supported and be healthy to continue her business.

loans.use: to be treated at a medical clinic

loans.name: Joann

texts.en:
This is Joann. She is 32 years old and is living in Intramuros, Manila, Phlippines. For almost three years, she has been busy running a computer shop. Her business is a great help for the family expenses, especially for her two children. 

Joann wants to ask for help from you. She wants to buy more computers for her business. She knows that if she will be able to purchase more computers, she will have the opportunity to make a better profit. So, with that, she wants to borrow a PHP 9,000 loan. 

With her dream to someday be successful and see her children finish college, she is working very hard to provide for the needs of the family. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more computers for her business.

loans.name: Genda

texts.en:
Genda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Genda is 42 years old and has three children who are in school.

Genda has a butcher shop business in the Philippines. Genda requested a PHP 12,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional meat to sell in the market.

Genda has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional meat to sell in the market

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 50 years old and has six children. Nilda is a woman and two of her children are in school.

Nilda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Nilda has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Chanloth's Group

texts.en: Chanloth is aged 27 years old, a mother of two children, and a rural villager living in Kampong Thom province. Nowadays, her family’s living depends on rice farming and repairing motorbikes to earn money. She has been involved in these businesses for six years. To improve her family’s living standard, she is now leading a group to take a small Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy a decent latrine. She hopes her family’s members will have good health through this loan.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is 56 years old and married with three children.  

Gaudiosa is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Gaudiosa requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

Gaudiosa has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Gaudiosa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Sinan's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Kratie province, Sinan is 57 years old and a mother of eight children. To earn her living, she grows cassava and rice as their main sources of income. She has been involved in this business for ages and it earns her about 25,200 KHR per day. This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. 

Sinan is leading a group of two members to take a new loan. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava farm

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. Gina is married and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Gina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Gina has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy is one of the beneficiaries of the employment program of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative.* He is Single and works as as a Sewing Machine Mechanic in a garment factory in GMA, Cavite, Philippines. He services, maintains and repairs sewing machines. His work includes adjusting machine parts, setting the timing, dismantling machines, replacing broken parts and installing specified parts on machines. 
 
Randy assists his aging parents in their household expenses. As a minimum wage earner coupled with the increasing cost of living, Randy's salary is not enough to pay their utilities and this forced him borrow from money lenders with very high interest rates and who require them to surrender their ATMs as loan collaterals.

Therefore Randy is asking for your financial assistance to avoid being exploited by loan sharks. He trusts for your positive response on his need to help him pay their utilities and to recover his ATM for he no longer wants to be enslaved by loan sharks. He does his best to be a very good sewing mechanic to have a promotion and thus earn higher income. He has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and he had no problem in repaying since the loan payment is deducted every pay day. He is thanking God and you in advance for your great help. 

He meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his work. ** CCT staff and volunteers conduct weekly fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their work routine to do Bible readings, prayer and discipleship sessions to encourage and inspire them to perform well in their jobs and be the kind of person God wants them to be. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

loans.use: To pay for utilities such as water and electricity bills.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is 48 years old and married with three children. 

Ignacia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ignacia requested a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her business.

Ignacia has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Ignacia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita works hard to support her family. Isabelita is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Isabelita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Isabelita has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Isabelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Josephine is 47 years old and has three children who are in school.

Josephine has a buy-and-sell fruit business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for one year. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 53 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lourdes has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Lourdes has been in this business for 26 years. Lourdes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Meri

texts.en: Meri is 57 years old. She lives in the Telavi district with her son Giogi. The only source of income for the family is Giorgi's monthly salary working as a distributor. Meri wants to start a business and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to apply for a loan of 3,900 USD. With the received credit, Meri will go to Turkey, where she will purchase a wide assortment of clothes to resell in Telavi at higher price. The trading business will give Meri a chance to generate income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to begin trade clothes

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Thirteen years ago Ruth started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Kanyakine, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of three children sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk that makes her very proud. 

Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a humble time milking and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where animals can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Ruth believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Ruth waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit for the housing and care of her cows

loans.name: Consuelo Margoth

texts.es: Consuelo tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y sus 5 hijas tienen 4, 7, 10, 13 y 18 años de edad, de ellos 4 estan estudiando. Consuelo vive en la casa de su madre con ella, sus hijos y su  padrastro. Consuelo se dedica a trabajar al jornal y  a sembrar pequeñas huertas de alverja y demás productos propios para su localidad. Consuelo solicita al dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de abono y fungicidas para cuidar sus cultivos. Consuelo tiene la aspiración de mejorar sus cultivos y  seguir trabajando  para pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 32 years old. She is a single mother with 5 daughters who are 4, 7, 10, 13 and 18 years of age. Four of them are currently in school.

Consuelo lives in her mother's house with her children, her mother and stepfather.

Consuelo works as a day laborer and cultivates small vegetable gardens of peas and other local crops.

Consuelo is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and fungicides to care for her gardens. She hopes to improve her vegetable production and keep working to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicides.

loans.name: Tom's Group

texts.en:
Tom, 45, is a rural villager living in Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of two children and one of them is in school while the other one is too young to go to school.  Growing rice on two hectares farmland and factory worker are the sources of her family’s income for twenty two years. She could earn about 64,000KHR per day. 

Now she is faced with a problem of lacking fund to help the farm, so she decided to form a group to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund.  As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy seeds for farming. She hopes to gain more yields than last year and improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for farming in order to improve her family's living standard

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Iy

texts.en:
A 47-year-old mother of six children and only two of them are in school; Iy is living in Kampong Cham province. Growing rice on three hectares farmland and working in a factory are the sources of her family’s income for more than five years. Through these businesses, she could earn about USD15.5 for supporting her family’s daily needs. 

As her crops did not grow well last year, her expected income was depreciated and now she has a lack of money to do her farming.  So she is applying for a new loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming.  She hopes to gain more yields than last year and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for a better rice crop this year

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Mab's Group

texts.en:
Mab, 32, is a villager living in Kampong Cham province and a mother of three children, one of them is in school while the other two are too young to go to school. Growing rice and fishing are the sources of her family’s income for twelve years. Through these businesses, she could earn about 38,900KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy fishing tools and take the rest of this money to buy fertilizer for her farming. She hopes the loan will help her to earn more income through fishing and gain more yields than previous years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve her rice crop and also buy new fishing equipment

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hector es un estudiante que esta poniendo todo de si para poder crecer y ser alguien en la vida, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda. El quiere ser un profesional exitoso que con trabajo y lucha vaya mejorando.
Pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Hector is a student who is putting his all into being able to grow and be someone in life. He says that he used his previous loan to be able to pay the degree fees, which was a great help. He wants to be a successful professional which, with work and struggle, he is improving. 

He asks for another loan to again pay the university fees and, with this, be able to continue paying  for his studies as has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esperanza  está en su ciclo número 1º del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo, donde todas las integrantes de este grupo quieren crecer y salir adelante, todo esto apoyado en el programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ana, quien es peluquera, es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, y comenta que tiene ya muchos clientes y que gracias a ello tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Comenta que su sueño es poder crecer en su negocio y con ello poder seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida para ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios, como ser shampoo, enjuagues, cremas, tintes, y otros, de manera a dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando.
texts.en:
The Esperanza group is in its first loan cycle with the women's committee program. It is a new group, where all the members of the group want to grow and get ahead. All of this is supported in the poverty elimination program. 

One of the members is Ana, who is a hairstylist. She is a woman who is very good at what she does and says that she now has many customers and that, thanks to this, she has the means to be able to help her family. She says that her dream is to be able to grow in her business and with it be able to continue improving her living conditions to help her loved ones.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase various supplies such as shampoo, rinses, creams, dyes, and more, as a way to provide better customer services. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to continue growing and improving

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, rinses, creams, dyes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
She is a resident from the town of Talibon, Bohol. Her name is Barbara; she is 54 years of age and engages in fishing. She sells fish to the locals in her place.  She is married, with seven children . Her youngest child is 15. She has been engaged in fishing for more than 20  years. She needs capital to finance the materials needed for her livelihood.

Barbara has requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy fishing net, fish cage and  weights.  With these, her on-going catch will improve and enable her to provide her family with nutritious diets.

She is determined to manage her existing livelihood to become progressive in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, fish cage and  weights

loans.name: Norafil

texts.en:
Thanks to you lenders! Recently, Norafil was granted a PHP 14,000 loan for her inventory. Having this amount, she ably bought more quantities of stocks of ingredients and products associated with her food stall business. Having been able to induce greater sales, Norafil found a better source of income for the family. Thus, she was able to support the household's basic needs. 

However, she still needs a certain amount this time that will help her maintain the business operations. She is requesting to take a loan worth PHP 19,000 that she will use to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables an other ingredients needed in her food stall. Your help today can be a great start for a better business and life that awaits to Norafil. This is why she is very hopeful that you will allow her request. 

She simply dreams of being successful someday in her business.She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Maria Auxiliadora es de la ciudad de Luque, son 17 mujeres muy unidas que quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos, ellas están esforzándose y ponen todo de sí para poder lograrlo.
Una de las integrantes es Gabriela, quien se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, es una mujer muy trabajadora, quien se dedica a este humilde trabajo con el cual puede mantener y dar a su familia una vida digna. Ella está poniendo lo mejor de sí para poder crecer, y por medio de las capacitaciones poder lograrlo.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de remedios naturales, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, luchando por una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The group Maria Auxiliadora is from the city of Luque. They are 17 very close-knit woman who want to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones. They are working hard and putting their all into being able to achieve it. 

One of the members is Gabriela, who works selling natural medicines. She is a very hard-working woman who works at this humble job with which she can support and provide a dignified life for her family. She is putting the best of herself into being able to grow and this is through the training to be able to realize it. 

She asks for this loan to purchase natural medicines and, with it, be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing, struggling for a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase natural medicines for sale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 48 years old, married with two children.

Janet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, coffee, candies, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Janet has borrowed and paid  loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Janet aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, coffee, candies, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 52 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Juanita has a general store business in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Juanita has been in this business for 5 years. Juanita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jenifer Johanna

texts.es:
La sonrisa de Jenifer lo dice todo, la felicidad y el orgullo de poder salir adelante con su familia, gracias a su esfuerzo trabajando e invirtiendo en su libreria. Esta madre de 38 años de edad, agradece a todas las personas que le apoyaron en el préstamo anterior que le permitió crecer un poco más en su negocio, puesto que con este pudo comprar mercadería y así ofrecer todo lo necesario para ir clases. Además con este mismo pudo comprar una computadora y una fotocopiadora para agregar a su lista la producción de copias.  
Actualmente Jenifer sigue contando con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se siente muy orgulloso por ver como el negocio va avanzando. Por esta razón, esta comerciante solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar de cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores, marcadores, entre otros materiales para este segundo semestre del año escolar. Con esta nueva inversión podrá seguir creciendo y llegar a ahorrar para comprar unas máquinas de emplasticado y de encolochar para ofrecer mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Jenifer's smile says it all: the happiness and pride of being able to get ahead with her family, thanks to her effort working and investing in her bookstore.  This mother, 38, is grateful to all the people who supported her with the previous loan, which allowed her to grow a little more in her business, because she was able to buy merchandise and sell all the necessary school supplies.  She also was able to buy a computer and a photocopier, adding copying to her list.

Currently Jenifer still has the support of her husband, who's very proud to see how her business is moving forward.  That's why this merchant is requesting another loan to buy notebooks, pencils, erasers, markers, and other supplies for the second half of the school year.  With this new investment she'll be able to keep growing and saving to buy laminating and curling machines to offer better service.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, erasers, markers, and other supplies

loans.name: Ma. Amy

texts.en:
Ma. Amy is 45 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Amy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like shampoo, cereals, noodles, cooking oil, candies, beer, etc. to sell.

Ma. Amy has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, cereals, noodles, cooking oil, candies, beer, etc. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like shampoo, cereals, noodles, cooking oil, candies, beer, etc. to sell

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
La pared del taller de Luis está adornada por diferentes partes de bicicletas, entrar es toda una aventura que te hace sentir como si estas en un museo. Desde hace dos años, este emprendedor de tan solo 23 años edad, decidió salir adelante con su esposa y su pequeño de tres años de edad, después de estar desempleado por un tiempo prefirió aprovechar sus conocimientos en reparación de bicicletas y así facilitar el plato de comida en su hogar.
Luis es un joven bastante familiar, por lo que todo el tiempo está en consideración con su familia para mejorar su calidad de vida y de las de los demás integrantes de su casa. Por esta razón, él solicita un préstamo para comprar aceite, pedales, manubrios, llantas, rines, entre otras piezas para mejorar el servicio de su taller de bicicletas. En sus planes esta ampliar el negocio y diversificar los productos para su taller.
texts.en:
The wall of Luis' workshop is adorned with different bicycle parts. Entering it is an adventure that makes you feel as if you were in a museum. For two years now, this entrepreneur of only 23 years decided to get ahead with his wife and three-year-old son. After being unemployed for a while, he preferred to take advantage of his knowledge in bicycle repair and so to help in getting a dinner plate to his home.

Luis is a very family-oriented young man. He always takes his family into consideration and tries to improve their quality of life and that of the other people who live with them. Because of this reason, he requests a loan to buy oil, pedals, handlebars, tyres and wheels among other parts to improve the service in his bicycle repair workshop. Among his plans he wants to enlarge his business and diversify the products in his workshop.

loans.use: to buy oil, pedals, handlebars, tyres and wheels among other parts

loans.name: Maribell

texts.es:
Maribell siempre fue una mujer independiente, quien trabajo todo el tiempo para salir adelante hasta que estableció su pulpería que ahora lleva más de trece años funcionando y de la cual se siente muy contenta por ver el progreso. Ella agradece a todas las personas que le apoyaron con el préstamo anterior, puesto que con este pudo aumentar sus ganancias al ofrecer mayor variedad de productos.  
Si bien los sueños de esta emprendedora se han ido realizando poco a poco gracias a su esfuerzo incondicional, ella quiere seguir invirtiendo para mejorar su negocio y, por supuesto, su calidad de vida. Razón por la cual solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, harina, sopas instantáneas, café, entre otros productos de gran demanda de su pulpería. Este nuevo inventario le permitirá aumentar sus ganancias y ahorrar para mejorar su vivienda, como siempre lo ha deseado.
texts.en:
Maribell was always an independent woman. She worked all the time to get ahead until she started her general store, which has now been open for more than thirteen years. She feels very happy to see how it has progressed. She thanks all the people who helped her with the previous loan, since thanks to it she was able to increase her earnings by offering a greater variety of products.

Even though the dreams of this entrepreneur have been fulfilled little by little thanks to her unconditional efforts, she wants to continue investing to improve her business, and of course, her quality of life.

This is the reason why she requests a new loan to buy rice, beans, flour, instant soups and coffee among other high-demand products for her general store. This new inventory will permit her to increase her income and to save to improve her home, something that she has always wished.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, flour, instant soups and coffee among other products

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is 60 years old and has 10 children. He is a farmer and also a veterinary doctor. He began the business to sustain his family. Henry wants to buy agrochemicals for his plants, especially tomatoes, cabbages, and oranges. He thinks these will improve his output. The clients are market vendors who sell the fruits and vegetables to the public. He hopes to educate his children and to develop his business. His challenge is weather changes. He is hard-working and honest.

loans.use: to buy agrochemicals

loans.name: Chheang's Group

texts.en:
Chheang, 51, is villager living in Kampong Cham province and a mother of a child. Rice farming is the main sources of her family’s income source for more than five years. She could earn about 41,700KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to access a new Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming. She hopes to gain more yield than last years through this kind loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to increase her rice yield this season

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 24 años, es del Chaco, está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, por medio de sus estudios quiere poder abrirse camino y el día de mañana ser una profesional exitosa.
Ella quiere también poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos por medio de sus estudios. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Maria is 24 years old, is from Chaco, and is studying for a degree in business administration. Through her studies, she wants to be able to open doors and in the future be a successful professional. 

She wants to be able to help her family and her loved ones through her education. She asks for this loan to be able to pay her program fees and, with it, be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth 29 years old, supports a family of 4 members. 

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 9 years earning an income of KES 13,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her farming. 

Her future hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en: Rohat is 49 years old. She lives in Khujand city, in the Sogd region. Rohat is married and living with her husband and two daughters. Rohat has a shop and is selling groceries there. She has engaged in this business for 15 years. Her husband helps and supports her with her business. She will spend this loan buying more groceries to sell in her shop and increase the business. Rohat is a very kind, hardworking and reliable person. She has high hopes for your support because she does not have enough money.

loans.use: Buy groceries to sell in her shop and increase her business

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar es un joven humilde con aspiraciones a futuro, está estudiando la carrera de derecho. Está estudiando para poder convertirse en un abogado exitoso.
Oscar quiere ser un buen profesional, y es por ello que pone su mejor esfuerzo. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y con ello poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Oscar is a humble young with aspirations for the future. He is studying for a law degree. He is studying to be able to become a successful lawyer.

Oscar wants to be a good professional and for this reason he puts forth his best effort. He asks for this loan to be able to pay his university fees and, with that, be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, está cursando dos carreras en el año una es Administración de Empresas y la otra es Derecho.
Su meta es llegar a ser un profesional para poder ser alguien en la vida y así poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios, luchando por ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Javier is from the city of Paraguarí. He is studying for two degrees in the year, one is business administration and the other is law.

His goal is to be a professional to be able to be someone in life and, so, be able to help his family. 

He asks for this loan to be able to pay the fees for his degree, and with that, be able to continue with his education, struggling to be someone in life.

loans.use: to pay fees for his degree.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 39 years, married, and supports a family of six members. 

He has been practicing farming for the last five years, earning KES 8,000. 

James has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and seedlings  for high production to sell to his customers for more gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to build rentals in the area. 

His future hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm input like fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Judith is 34 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Judith has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines. Judith requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of dry goods like sandals, slippers, blouses, etc. to sell to her customers.

Judith has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Judith would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dry goods like sandals, slippers, blouses, etc. to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, dresses and shorts, and other kinds of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Maricel requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for three years now.

Maricel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ángela es una mujer trabajadora, que siendo madre de cuatro hijos, esposa de un hombre que la apoya todo el tiempo y comerciante de una pequeña pulpería donde su fuerte es la venta de verduras, se siente como nueva siendo activa laboralmente a sus 41 años de edad. Esta mujer ya lleva más de diez años en este negocio, suficientes para ser conocida por su amabilidad y honestidad. 
Para Ángela, el emprender su negocio fue una forma de convertirse en un modelo a seguir de responsabilidad y seriedad para sus hijos, lo que más tarde le aseguro que estos se sintieran apasionados al entrar a la escuela. Su mayor sueño es convertir su negocio en una miscelánea, por lo que va a seguir invirtiendo solicitando un préstamo para comprar verduras, arroz, frijoles, leche, pan, entre otros productos de gran demanda. En sus planes esta mejorar el local de su negocio y el de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ángela is a hardworking mother of four with a husband who supports her tirelessly. She works in a small grocery store that specializes in selling vegetables.  She feels like a new woman now that she is back in the workforce at the age of 41.  She has over 10 years of experience in this business, which is enough to be recognized for her kindness and honesty.  For Ángela, starting her business was a way of becoming a role model in responsibility and seriousness for her children so that they would be passionate about their educations.

Her biggest dream is to turn her store into a general store, which is why she will continue to invest in it.  She is seeking this loan to purchase vegetables, rice, beans, milk, bread and other products that are in high demand.  Among her plans are renovating her business and her home.

loans.use: purchase vegetables, rice, beans, milk, bread and other products.

loans.name: Ia

texts.en:
Ia is 67 years old from Abasha district. She is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, Ia grows maize on 1 hectare of agricultural land and sells the harvest locally. She started new business and has just opened a small shop in her yard.  She needs money to purchase stock of products. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1500 GEL. With the received credit Ia will purchase products such as: sugar, flour and so on. She will be able to increase the income and with increased income expand business to generate more profit.  Ia awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, flour and other items for her newly opened shop

loans.name: Sokheng's Group

texts.en:
Sokheng, 33, is a mother of seven children, three of whom are in school. They are living in Kampong Cham province. For more than five years, her family’s living has depended on growing rice on 0.5 hectares farmland, cassava on one hectare and working on another farm for a fee. Through these businesses, she could earn about 36,100KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds to do the farm, she is now leading a group of three to access a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and pay for a plowing fee. 

She hopes this loan will help her to gain more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for a plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Lay's Group

texts.en:
Lay, 40, is living with her six children family in Kampong Cham province. Growing rice on one hectare farmland, growing cassava on four hectares farmland and working on other farm for fee are the sources of her family’s income. She has been involved in these businesses for twenty two years and it earns her about 79,800KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group of two to take a new Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fees. She hopes her crops will grows well and gain her more yields than last year.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer to improve her rice and cassava crops and pay for plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama LA ALEGRIA cuenta con 18 integrantes y están en el primer ciclo todas con actividades económicas, la mayoría se dedican al comercio y a actividades rurales. Son de la ciudad de Santaní, una zona alejada de la capital del país que quieren mejorar cada día por medio de sus esfuerzos unidos.
La señora ILUMINADA, una de ellas, cuenta con una despensa bien surtida en su casa, donde ofrece productos de necesidades básicas del hogar,  a todos sus clientes. Comenta que al principio le fue difícil cuando empezó su negocio, pero se fue abriendo camino y ya es más que conocida en el barrio.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su negocio con verduras, frutas, carnes, panificados y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día y con ello poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The "La Alegria" communal bank has eighteen members and they are in their first season. They all work in the economic sector, the majority of them doing business and rural activities. They are all from the city of Santaní, an area that is far from the country's capital that they want to improve day by day through their joint efforts.

One of the women, named Iluminada, has a well-stocked pantry in her home, where she offers basic household products to all her customers. She mentions that it was difficult for her at the beginning when she started her business, but that she has gained momentum and she is already well-known in the neighborhood.

She is requesting this loan to stock her store with vegetables, fruit, meat, baked goods and other products.

She is thankful for the opportunity she is getting to improve herself each day and to help her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, meat, baked goods and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and farm tools for farming activity so as to increase agricultural produce and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Rudiah

texts.en:
Rudiah is 29 years old, married to Jared, and supports a family of four members. 

She has been practicing small-scale farming for the last 10 years, earning an income of KES 15,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and stabilize her farming. 

Her future hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: To improve her farming by buying fertilizer and seedlings so she can raise more income to meet family demands.

loans.name: Hector Jaiter

texts.es:
Hector tiene 41 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos en el distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su motocarguera, realiza esta actividad hace 05 años y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita préstamo para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Hector espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hector is 41 years old, partnered, and lives with his two children in a house he owns in Oyotún district which is located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The people in this district work in agriculture, commerce and raising animals.

He works providing transportation service with his cargo motorcycle. He has been doing this work for 5 years and has good personal and work references in the zone. He asks for a loan to do some repairs and maintenance work on his vehicle which is currently in bad condition. With this, Hector hopes to offer better customer service which will allow him to get better income which will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to repair and do some maintenance to his vehicles which is currently in bad condition.

loans.name: 30 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer de 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 11 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘la Angostura’  ubicada a 50 Km. al oeste de la ciudad, las casas están distribuidas en forma ordenada alrededor de la plaza, las calles son de tierra, no cuenta con alcantarillado y tiene 2 escuelas públicas y un centro médico. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Victoria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla en familia también habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada a la derecha, viste vestido floreado). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como comerciante y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua potable. Debido a sus deseos de superación formó una banca de personas con negocios como; peluquería, venta de comida, venta de verduras, venta de materiales de costura, librería, carnicería, tejido de ropa de bebe y tienda de barrio, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano cómo; pantalones, poleras, camisas, camisetas, camisas, blusas, chompas, chamarras, etc., ella necesita abastecer su negocio con mayor variedad y cantidad de ropa para competir en el mercado, también desea abrir otra tienda en el mismo rubro en otro mercado. “mi negocio crece y los clientes son continuos, debo abrir otro puesto de venta…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son continuas, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para poder abrir otro puesto de venta. Su sueño es abrir 2 puestos de venta en 2 mercados, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Victoria solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para abrir un nuevo puesto de venta y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Victoria is a 31 year old woman who lives with her partner. She has two children ages 3 and 11, and she works selling secondhand clothing. She is a good mother, patient, a good listener, supportive, responsible and hardworking.  She works in the "La Angostura" community located 50km west of the city.  The houses are built in a well-organized manner around the plaza, with dirt roads, no sewage system, two public schools and a medical center.  The climate is subtropical with a temperature that varies during the day from 21 to 35 degrees celsius.  

Victoria is tan, has dark eyes, and long black hair that she keeps tied.  She is short and thin, and her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks at home and with her family, but she also speaks Spanish. In the attached photograph she is seated on the right, wearing a flowered dress. She lives with her partner, who works as a salesman, and their two children.  The eldest son is in school and the youngest is still too young for school. They live in a room made of brick and cement with a metal roof and a cement floor. They have electricity and running water.  

Given their desires to get ahead, they started a lending group made up of people with businesses such as: hairdressers, food sales, vegetable sales, sewing material sales, bookstores, butcher ships, making baby clothing, and convenience stores. This group allows them to apply for loans and improve their businesses.  

Victoria's business is selling secondhand clothing such as: pants, turtlenecks, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, sweaters, jackets, etc.  She is in need of stocking her business with a greater variety of clothing so that she can compete in the marketplace.  She also hopes to open another clothing store in a different market. "My business grows and the customers are consistent, I need to open another store," says Victoria. The upside to her business is that her sales are consistent, the downside is that she is lacking the money to open a second location.  Her dream is to open two locations in two markets. She hopes to incest in her used clothing business.  This is her second loan with the institution in the past two years of working in this business.  For these reasons, Victoria is seeking a loan to purchase used clothing in bulk so that she can open a second location and improve her earnings.

loans.use: purchase secondhand clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 42 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 7 años, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos y productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio. 
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, optimista, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo, generosa, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su Trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’caracterizada por albergar a los damnificados del desborde del río en 1983, cuando muchas familias lo perdieron todo, situado a 12 kilómetros del área urbana central. los migrantes que fueron llegando desde las provincias y el resto del país se fueron asentando en esa zona que hoy tiene más del 20% del total de la población, cuenta con servicios básicos como; salud y educación. Es uno de los distritos más pobres. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Maria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello largo negro lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (de pie al centro, viste solera celeste). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado.  La necesidad de cubrir los gastos de sus hijos la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida, venta de verduras, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de desayunos, venta de bisutería, venta de cosméticos y servicio de llamadas, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; agua, pan, azúcar, papel, fideo, arroz, refrescos, galletas, productos de limpieza, etc., en su tienda de barrio, debido a la falta de comercio en el área no tiene mucha competencia. Actividad que realiza de forma independiente todos los días de la semana en horario del día, “el clima cálido del lugar hace que los alimentos se estropeen rápidamente, por eso se los debe mantener refrigerados…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que puede cuidar a sus hijos, la desventaja es la distancia de sus proveedores y de su tienda. Su sueño es abrir una empresa distribuidora para realizar ventas por mayor, ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra un refrigerador para mantener los alimentos frescos ya que el clima cálido los malogra rápidamente. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra un refrigerador para mantener los alimentos frescos y con los beneficios pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 42-year-old woman, single, who has 2 children, ages 4 and 7. Her business is selling food and basic items in her neighborhood store. 

She is a good mother, enterprising, optimistic, with a good attitude, committed to her work, generous, friendly, responsible, and very hard-working. She has her business in the Plan 3000 zone, characterized by lodging the survivors of the 1983 flood of the river, when many families lost everything. It is located 12 kilometers from the urban center. The migrants who arrived from the provinces and the rest of the country were settled in this area which today has 20% of the entire population. It has basic services such as health and education. It is one of the poorest districts. It has a warm sub-tropical climate with temperatures that vary between 21-35 degrees centigrade during the day. 

Maria has dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair she keeps tied back, is short, has a robust physique, her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks in this place and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business she does (she is standing in the center, wearing a light blue t-shirt). She shares her life with her children; the older one is in school and the younger one is not school-aged yet. They live in a room they own built of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting and a brick floor which has drinking water, electricity and sewer service. The need to cover her children's expenses brought her to form a bank of people with businesses such as food sales, vegetables sales, second-hand clothing sales, breakfast sales, costume jewelry sales, cosmetic sales, and calling service, to ask for a loan and improve their businesses. Her business is selling food and basic products such as water, bread, sugar, paper, noodles, rice, soft drinks, cookies, cleaning products, etc. in her neighborhood store. Due to the lack of business in the area, there isn't much competition. She does the work independently every day of the week during the day. "The hot climate of the area makes the food spoil quickly, for this reason they should be kept refrigerated..." she says. The advantage of her business is that she can care for her children, the disadvantage is the distance from her providers to her store. Her dream is to open a wholesale business to do bulk sales. She wants to expand her business, purchasing a refrigerator to keep the food fresh since the warm climate they rot quickly. This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the 10 years she has done this work. 

For these reasons, Maria asks for a loan to purchase a refrigerator to keep the food fresh, and with the earnings pay her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to keep the food fresh and with the earnings, pay for her children's school expenses.

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.en:
Exaltacion is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Exaltacion is 44 years old and has two children who are in school.

Exaltacion has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Exaltacion requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Exaltacion has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Exaltacion would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en: A 45-year-old mother of two children who are all in school, San is living in Kampong Thom province. Growing vegetables and working on other farms have been the sources of her family’s income for more than five years. Now she is leading a group of four to apply for a loan via VisionFund by using her loan portion to buy a decent latrine. She hopes her family will have a better living condition and be healthy.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Mercelita

texts.en:
Mercelita is 50 years old and married with one child.

Mercelita is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mercelita has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Mercelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Huo's Group

texts.en:
Hou is aged 65, a mother of six children, living in Kampong Cham province. Growing rice on two hectares farmland has been the main source of her family’s income for more than ten years. She can earn about 63,300 KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds to do the farming, she is now leading a small group to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy farming supplies to help her support her family. She hopes to earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Marjina

texts.en:
Marjina is a 54-year-old entrepreneur from a small village, Palash Bari, in Alipurduar. She lives there with her husband two sons. She is illiterate and can sign her name only.

As Marjina's husband Jamir has grown old, he is now unable to work, so her sons have engaged them in a gunny sack-selling business for the family’s livelihood. A gunny sack is an inexpensive bag made of jute and is traditionally used for transporting grains, potatoes, and other agricultural products.

Marjina's sons buy gunny sacks from the wholesale market and sell them in the local market shops and to retailers. Marjina helps her sons in this business, but the income does not support the family to cover all the family’s expenses. So, Marjina decided to invest in her sons’ gunny sack business in order to provide more to her family.

As there is a great demand for their gunny sacks in the market, Marjina is determined to succeed despite many challenges, but the greatest of them is lack of capital to expand the business. So, she has asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase gunny sacks in bulk from the wholesale market.

She hopes the profit generated from this business will enable her to reach her goal to expand the business smoothly.

She thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase gunny sacks in bulk for the existing business.

loans.name: Biba's Group

texts.fr: Biba qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang au centre, portant un foulard rouge, est membre d’un groupe de 16 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Mamissa au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Biba, âgée de 45 ans, est la mère de 3 enfants âgés de 17 à 24 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa familleet l’a incité à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 6 ans. Elle explique que l’agriculture représente "l'avenir." Biba cultive l'arachide, le mais sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériel agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Biba entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro et de la conviction des agents myAgro sur les bénéfices apportés par la méthode myAgro. Cette année Biba effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 6 ans que Biba cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Biba planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de diversifier ses cultures.
texts.en:
Biba, who is in the center in the first row, wearing a red scarf, is a member of a group of 16 farmers registered  with myAgro, living and working in the village of Mamissa in the southeast of Bamako, Mali. Biba, aged 45, is the mother of three children aged between 17 and 24, of whom two are presently enrolled in school. Agriculture permits her to ensure self-sufficiency for her family and this has motivated her to be involved in this activity for six years now. She explains that agriculture represents "the future".  

Biba cultivates peanuts and maize on her plot but as a farmer, she has to face difficulties such as a lack of rain, of agricultural supplies, and of high-quality fertilizer.  

Biba is beginning her first year with myAgro and she registered because of the perspective of being able to increase her yield with the services proposed by myAgro and  due to the conviction of myAgro agents concerning the benefits brought by the myAgro method. This year Biba is making payments to buy a myAgro package of OPV (openly pollinated variety) seeds and fertilizer for growing peanuts so as to increase her yields on her plot of 0.0625 hectares. 

Biba has been cultivating peanuts for six years now for their value as a foodstuff, explaining the peanuts are directly edible by the family and are used as a basic sauce in cooking. They also have a commercial value since peanuts are a foodstuff she sells at the market. Biba is planning on the increase in her yield and her income to diversify her crops.

loans.use: to buy herself a package of OPV seeds and fertilizer for growing peanuts

loans.name: Sokhun's Group

texts.en:
Sokhun is age 45 years old, a married mother of two children who are both in school, and is living in Kampong Cham province.

Growing rice on two hectares of farmland and working on other farms for a fee are the sources of her family’s income. She has been involved in these businesses for more than five years, and she could earn about 48,900 KHR per day.

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a new loan to buy farming supplies to support her current business. She hopes to earn more income and have the ability to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers so as to increase soil fertility for better agricultural produce, and to meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Agripina tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 10 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, cuenta con clientes fijos quienes dan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ropa para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto ella espera poder satifacer los gustos de sus clientes y asi poder incrementar sus ventas lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Agripina is 44 years old, is married and lives in her own home in a rural area in the Oyotún district, a community dedicated to agriculture and animal husbandry. It is located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, North Coast of Peru.

She makes a living from the sale of clothing for women, men and children. She has been doing this for 10 years now. Her business is located in her home. She has fixed customers who give her very good personal and job references.

She requests a loan to purchase a greater quantity of clothing to increase the stock of her business. With this she hopes to be able to satisfy the preferences of her customers and to increase her income, which will improve the quality of her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of clothing to increase the stock of her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and farm tools so as to get a better harvest and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Joseph Steven

texts.es:
Joseph es un joven con sus metas bien trazadas, inicio a los quince años de edad a estudiar en la universidad y ahora a sus veinte años, ya está en su último año de la licenciatura de ingeniería en sistemas. Apoyado por sus abuelos, se ha abierto paso en el mundo académico, principalmente para hacerlos sentir orgullosos de él y devolverles un poco el esfuerzo que han hecho para que el nunca abandonara su sueño de ser ingeniero. 
Este es un joven apasionado por la tecnología, actualmente tiene un trabajo en una empresa que brinda soporte técnico, Joseph ya está a un paso de obtener su título, es por eso que solicita a Kiva y MiCrédito un préstamo para cancelar los gastos de su curso de titulación, dado que tener su diploma le abriría un mundo de nuevas oportunidades laborales. Su sueño más grande es poder ser jefe de una sala de informática.
texts.en:
Joseph is a young man with well-established goals. At the age of fifteen, he began to study at the university and now at twenty, he is in his last year in his systems engineering degree. Supported by his grandparents, he has opened a path in the academic world, primarily to make them proud of him and return a bit of the efforts that they have made so that he never abandoned his dream of being an engineer. 

This is a young man who is passionate about technology. He currently has a job in a business that offers technical support. Joseph is just a step away from getting his degree, it is for this reason that he asks Kiva and MiCrédito for a loan to pay the fees to register his degree, given that having his diploma will open a world of new work opportunities for him. His biggest dream is to be able to be the manager of a computer lab.

loans.use: to pay the fees to register his degree.

loans.name: Phin's Group

texts.en: Phin, 45, is a mother of five children, living in Kampong Thom province. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and growing vegetables for sale. She has been involved in these businesses for more than five years and it earns her about 19,700KHR per day. Due to lack of money to buy a decent latrine for her family’s uses, so she is now leading a group to take a new loan via VisionFund to fulfill her need. She hopes to improve her family’s standard of living through this loan portion.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
Akaki is 22 years old. He is married and lives with his wife in Akhmeta district. Akaki used to go with his truck to the forest and bring wood to sell among the villagers. He sold the truck and is no longer involved in this activity. 

Akaki wants to start a new business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 2300 GEL. With the received credit he will purchase a car and will start a taxi business. Akaki will be able to generate income and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start up a taxi business

loans.name: Gilda

texts.pt:
Nasceu na província de Maputo tem 30 anos de idade, é solteira mãe de dois filhos menores de idade, responsabiliza-se pelo seu pai que vive em sua casa.
Trabalha nas Bombas como caixa a mais de 7 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Pois com o fundo próprio não conseguia erguer a sua obra de residência, já trabalhando com a Hluvuku superou todas dificuldades, hoje tem a sua casa própria. E para terminar a mesma solícita um empréstimo para adquirir material de construção como: areia grossa, cimento, blocos e mais. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende finalizar a sua obra e adquirir uma viatura para o transporte pessoal. O sue maior desafio é garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior.
texts.en: Gilda was born in the province of Maputo.  She is 30 years old and a single mother to two young children.  She also supports her father, who lives with  her.  She has worked as a cashier at a gas station for more than 7 years, and earns a salary that she applies to household expenses.  However, with her own money she was not able to build a house.  Working with Hluvuku she has been able to overcome her difficulties and now she has a house of her own.  She is requesting a loan to purchase materials such as coarse sand, cement, and cement blocks to continue construction on her home.  This is her third loan with Hluvuku.  In the future she plans to complete construction and purchase a car for personal transportation.  Her greatest challenge is to ensure an education for her children through high school.

loans.use: to purchase coarse sand, cement, cement blocks, etc.

loans.name: Soltan

texts.en:
Soltan is married with three children. He lives in Fuzuli region where near the war zone, with his family. But his family is an IDP(Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city.

For over 23 years. Soltan has been in the animal breeding business and loves his job. This is Soltan's second loan, The first loan he repaid in time.  Now he has applied to Komak for a loan of 1000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) for vaccinations for his animals. He thankful for this loan to Kiva organization and lenders. In the future for increase his business Soltan wants to build a new stall for cows.

loans.use: for vaccinate the animals, increase business and in future to build a new stall for cows

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
Nasceu na província de Maputo tem 37 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, mãe de 4 filhos apenas 1 é maior de idade, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe que vive em Namaacha.
Trabalha como chefe da cozinha a mais de 6 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência solícita um empréstimo para adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento, pedras e mais. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência, mobilar, contrair matrimónio e iniciar um negócio de venda de produtos de beleza.
texts.en: Amelia was born in the province of Maputo.  She is 37 years old and lives with her common law husband.  She has  4 children, one of whom is an adult. All attend school.  She also supports her mother who lives in Namaacha.  Amelia has worked as a chef for more than 6 years, and earns money for household expenses.  In order to continue construction on her home she is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, and stones.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku.
