In the future she plans to finish construction on her home, formalize her marriage, and start a business selling beauty products.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, stones, etc.

loans.name: Las Cumplidas Group

texts.es:
Yesica es una joven mujer de 19 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es la venta de refrescos típicos.
Ella es emprendedora, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en un puesto de venta en las afueras de su casa ubicado en la zona sur de su ciudad, donde se encuentran las playas del río Piraí, ahí estás las cabañas que ofrecen para comer, comida típica, como; el majadito (carne deshidratada), patasca (cabeza de cerdo al horno) y locro (mix de carnes con maíz), entre otros. También los sabrosos “horneaos”, ideales para acompañar el café de la tarde. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura constante de aproximadamente 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Yesica es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, estatura mediana, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Quechua que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (la 3 de la izquierda, viste blusa negra y short azul corto). Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que trabajan en el comercio del mercado, viven en una casa propia construida de madera con piso de tierra que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de tomates, taller de costura, venta de ropa de segunda mano, tejidos, venta de pescado, servicio de construcción y elaboración de colchones, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de refrescos tradicionales del lugar, como; Mocochinchi (preparado con duraznos secos hervidos), Chicha (preparada en base a maíz), Somó (similar a la Chicha pero incluye el hervido del maíz), y otros, “mi negocio continua mejorando, el anterior préstamo me sirvió para arrancar ahora necesito mejorar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para mejorar el negocio. Su sueño es tener un snack grande donde pueda ofrecer variedad de comidas y refrescos tradicionales. Ella desea realizar una inversión en la compra de mesas y sillas para poder atender a mayor número de clientes.  Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Yesica solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para poder atender a mayor número de clientes y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Yesica is a 19-year-old young woman, single, with no children, and her business is selling traditional drinks. 

She is enterprising, happy, optimistic, cheerful, has a positive attitude, is responsible, and very hard-working. Her business is located in a sales stall outside her house, located in the southern area of the city, where the beaches of the Piraí River are located. There, are the huts that offer traditional food to eat such as majadito (dried meat), patasca (baked pig's head), and locro (a mix of meats with corn), among others. The flavorful "horneaos" are also sold, ideal to accompany coffee in the afternoon. It has a warm sub-tropical climate with a constant temperature of approximately 30 degrees centigrade during the whole year. 

Yesica has dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair she keeps tied back, is of medium height, thin physique, her native language is Quechua which she speaks in her family and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the work she does (she is third from the left, wearing a black top and short blue shorts). She has her life in her parents' house, who work in a business in the market. They live in a house they own, built of wood with a dirt floor which has drinking water, electricity and sewer service. Her desires to improve herself brought her to lead a bank of people with business such as tomato sales, sewing shop, second-hand clothing sales, woven products, fish sales, construction service, and making mattresses, to ask for a loan and improve their businesses. Her business is the sale of traditional drinks from the area such as mocochinchi (made with boiled dried peaches), chicha (prepared with a corn base), somó (similar to chicha but includes boiled corn), and more. "My business continues improving, the previous loan allowed me to start, now I need to improve..." she says. The advantage of her business is that it has regular customers. The disadvantage is the lack of money to improve the business. Her dream is to have a large food stand where she can offer a variety of traditional food and drinks. She wants to invest in the purchase of tables and chairs to be able to serve more customers. This is her 3rd loan cycle with the institution in the 6 years she has been doing this work. 

For these reasons, Yesica asks for a loan to purchase tables and chairs to be able to serve a larger number of customers and improve her sales.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs to be able to serve a larger number of customers and improve her sales.

loans.name: Comuzone Iv Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “COMUZONE IV”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Margarita ella es viuda y tiene 63 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite,la socia es una mujer emprededora y luchadora por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos terminen de estudiar, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite,galletas y arroz.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de tejidos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de imprenta.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the “Comuzone IV” communal bank, which is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

Margarita is a widow and 63 years old. She has a grocery store business where she sells staple items like rice, sugar, milk and oil. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman; by means of this business she wants her children to finish their studies. She works from 8:00 a.m until 10:00 p.m.; she has had this business for a year and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand the grocery store business. She is asking for the loan to buy milk, sugar, oil, crackers and rice.

The other members make a living by selling clothing, selling fabrics, with a grocery store business and a printing business.

Margarita thanks those who form part of this dream by this means and she promises to make her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, crackers and rice

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 33 years old and has four children. Julie is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Julie is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Julie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

Julie has been raising cattle for 5 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Julie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and farm tools so as to get a better harvest and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry so as to have more eggs and chickens to sell for a better income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost her retail business by buying more stock to sell

loans.name: Lay's Group

texts.en:
Lay, 61, is a mother of four children, living in Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. Selling natural medicines and working on other farm for fee are the sources of her family’s income and she could earn about 55,800KHR per day. 
Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to apply for a loan via VisionFund to buy more kinds of natural medicine for resale. She hopes to earn more income through this loan portion.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of natural medicine for resale

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Qurbonoi

texts.en: Qurbonoi is a kind woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan into a family of workers. She is living in village with her family. She is married and has four children. She participated in a three day training provided by IMON to startup clients. She was an active participant in training and getting the  necessary information to how to open a business. She wants to do business in agriculture – keeping livestock for further selling. She is planning to make milk and sell dairy products. She is asking financial support from KIVA and IMON to buy livestock and start a new business.  She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start a new business

loans.name: Ilda

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Morrombone província de Inhambane tem 35 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, mãe de 5 filhos, todos frequentam a escola e não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Trabalha numa empresa Bananas como Operaria a mais de 2 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Solicita o empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo mercadoria como: arroz, feijão, sabão, açúcar e mais. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende expandir mais no seu negócio para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência.
texts.en: Ilda was born in  Morrombone, in the Inhambane province.  She is 35 years old and lives with her common law husband.  She has 5 children, all of whom attend school, and she does not support anyone else. She has worked at a banana company for two years and earns a salary that she applies to household expenses.  She is requesting a loan to increase the inventory for her own business, buying rice, beans, soap, and sugar, among other things.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku.  In the future she plans to expand her business and continue construction on her home.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, soap, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés tiene 68 años de edad vive, junto a su esposo e hijo en el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio de dulces tradicionales elaborados por la misma población y ganadería, se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de patos, pollos, gallinas y vacas lecheras, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y es conocida por la labor que realiza. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una vaca y de esta manera ofrecer la leche a sus clientes que la mayor parte se dedica a la elaboración de dulces de Zaña, y así generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Inés is 68 years old, lives with her husband and child in the district of Zaña, where the population works in agriculture, sales of traditional sweets made by the same people, and animal husbandry. It is located in the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. 

She works raising ducks, chick, hens, and dairy cows. She has experience in this business and is known for the work she does. She has asked for a loan to purchase a cow and in this way offer the milk to her customers, the majority of whom work making Zaña sweets, and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and in this way sell the milk to her customers.

loans.name: Sipora

texts.en:
Sipora is 42 years, married and supports a family of 7 members. 

She has been practicing food market for the last 13 years earning KES 9,000. 

Sipora has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy more food stocks for sale to her clients for more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to build rentals in the area. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more food stocks for sale to her clients for more income gain

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers so as to increase soil fertility for a better agricultural produce and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is from Carmona, Cavite, Philippines. Single and she support her family financially. She is one of the beneficiaries of the employment program of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative.*

Maricel works as a Clothing Packer. She ensures that items of clothing are packed properly and are ready for distribution. The type of packaging used depends on the type, value, fabric, and destination of the garments. One of the main concerns of factory employees is how to meet the needs of their family. With the increasing cost of living their monthly salary is not enough to adequately provide for their families which forced Marian to borrow from money lenders who charged very high interest rates and surrender her ATM (their salary is credited to her ATM) as her loan collateral. These low income employees sadly have no access to bank loans.

For this reason, Maricel is asking for your assistance to prevent her from submitting to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying them since the loan payment is deducted every pay day. She will appreciate much your positive response to her request to enable her pay for the construction materials needed to finish building her house. She is thanking God and you in advance for your good heart.

Maricel meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work. CCT staff and volunteers conduct weekly fellowship meetings for the factory workers before their work routine to do Bible readings, prayer and discipleship sessions to encourage and inspire them to do their best in life and to be the kind of person God wants them to be.

 *The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

loans.use: To pay for construction materials to complete construction of her house.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 48 years old and married with twelve children. With five children currently in school, Myrna works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, beers, coffee, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, beers, coffee, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Madalitso Group

texts.en:
Dolla, aged 24, has two children and only one goes to school. She owns a grocery in which she sells different types of products; she runs the business together with some of her family members. She started this business in order to support her family and to pay school fees for her children.

She will use the loan to expand her business by buying more commodities for her shop such as salt, sugar, and soap. Her main intention is to send her children to better schools and to build them a good house.

The loans have helped her to be economically empowered, as she is now able to provide basic needs to her children.

loans.use: to buy assorted items for her grocery

loans.name: Ruth Valeska

texts.es:
Luego de estudiar Administración de Empresas, Ruth, decidió emprender su propio negocio y puso una pulpería que suministra de granos básicos a todo su vecindario. Con el apoyo de familia su negocio ha crecido notablemente y la tienda que empezó solo con granos básico, con azúcar y arroz, ahora ofrece también embutidos, comida enlatada y otros artículos cotidianos, es por eso que esta responsable mujer ha logrado salir adelante. 
En esta temporada, Ruth, necesita reabastecerse de granos básicos, es por eso que solicita un préstamo que le permita comprar sacos de arroz, azúcar, frijoles y bidones de aceite, para nunca dejar de vender a sus fieles clientes. Esta es una mujer llena de sueños, su principal meta es hacer de su pulpería una miscelánea.
texts.en:
After studying business administration, Ruth decided to undertake her own business and established a convenience store that sells basic grains to the whole neighborhood. With family support, her business has grown noticeably and the store that began with only basic grains, with rice and sugar, now also offers cold cuts, canned goods, and other everyday products. It is with this that this responsible woman has managed to get ahead. 

In this season, Ruth needs to restock basic grains, and it is for this that she asks for a loan that will permit her to purchase sacks of rice, sugar, beans and jugs of oil, but never to stop selling to her loyal customers. She is a woman full of dreams, her primary goal is to make her convenience store into a general store.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, sugar, beans and jugs of oil.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a humble farmer who goes to work on his farm every morning. He is dedicated in full to his work. This man only thinks about going forward and delivering good produce. He knows that many people consume his farm products, and because of this, he makes sure his products are pure and of good quality. He is a 43-year-old farmer from Naitiri village, situated in the Rift valley province of Kenya. He lives with his wife and children on a small piece of land where he keeps cows and grows a wide variety of crops. 

For 10 years, his primary sources of income have been milk,a side hustle business(motorcycle business) and produce. His biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs, such as chemicals, to prevent these diseases. Nelson made a decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help him improve his farming activities. 

Sometime this month, he applied for a loan to expand his farm. This will enable him to expand his operations to increase the overall output. The additional income from the expansion will go to his children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is increasingly becoming prohibitive to low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out to start working to contribute their earnings to their families. With your loan, Nelson's children will acquire quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their bright future.

loans.use: To expand his horticulture farm for better produce thus enabling his children to stay in school

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas a través de las capacitaciones y el trabajo en equipo quieren ir mejorando por su familia y por salir de su situación de pobreza.
La Sra. Francisca solicita  este préstamo para invertir en su pequeño negocio de kiosco y en la compra de los productos que vende allí, como ser comestibles, bebidas, jugos, golosinas y otros. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que con sacrificio quiere poder salir adelante.
Francisca quiere poder capacitarse y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y también la de su familia.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) is in its 3rd cycle of the women’s communal bank program.  They are in the poverty elimination program where, through trainings and teamwork, they all want to continue improving for their families and to get out of poverty. 

Francisca is requesting this loan to invest in her small kiosk business and in the purchase of the products that she sells there, such as food items, drinks, juices, snacks and other things. 

She is a very hardworking person that with sacrifice wants to be able to get ahead.

Francisca wants to able to get training and improve living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase food items, drinks, juices, snacks and other things to be able to stock her kiosk.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria tiene 46 años de edad, vive con su hijo en casa familiar en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila ya que es una comunidad rural y pequeña que se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la actividad de elaboración y venta de pan y pasteles, cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de insumos para su panadería y pastelería, con esto ella espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de pasteles a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir obtener mayores ingresos que mejorarán su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 46 years old and lives with her son in their family home in the district of Cayaltí, a community where life is quiet as it is a small, rural community that makes a living through farming, livestock and trade. It is located in the province of Chiclayo in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. 

She makes a living making and selling bread and pastries. She has more than three years of experience in the business, and her business is located in her home. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase a greater quantity of supplies for her bakery and pastry shop. With this, she hopes to offer a wider variety of pastries to her customers – which will allow her to make more income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of supplies for her bakery and pastry shop.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a young farmer. She carries great responsibilities. She has one child and she is the main source of income in her household. Her life has been difficult. Nancy has been farming for the past 15 years. Through these years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops, and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Nancy is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals for resale. Kenya's Nandi hills area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Josephine could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Nancy, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Nancy believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Nancy to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going child.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys 36 years is married to Samwel and supports a family of 6 members. 

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 12 years earning KES 15,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy farm inputs particularly fertilizers and seedlings.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her farming. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs particularly fertilizers and seedlings to improve yield

loans.name: Srey Derng's Group

texts.en:
Srey Derng, 27, is a villager living in Kampong Cham province and a mother of two children, one of them is in school while the other one is too young to attend school. 

Cassava and rice farming are the sources of her family’s income for nine years.  She could earn about 67,200KHR per day. Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer, pesticide and pay for plowing fees. She hopes to earn more income and ability to buy more farmland to expand her farming area and renovate her old house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide for her cassava and rice fields and pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Pora está en su ciclo número 1 es un grupo nuevo que esta con muchas expectativas de poder mejorar y crecer y mejorar por medio de las capacitaciones hechas a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
La Sra. Rumilda solicita este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para poder hacer las comidas que ella vende, como ser carne, hortalizas, pollo, jamón, verduras y demás. Ella esta agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar cada día.
Rumilda es una mujer muy activa y por sobre todo entusiasta que quiere mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The "Kuña Pora" group is in its first cycle. It is a new group that has high expectations for improvement and growth by way of training done through the poverty elimination program.

Rumilda is requesting this loan to buy several supplies in order to make meals that she sells, such as beef, vegetables, chicken, ham, greens and other foods. She is grateful for the opportunity she is given to grow and improve every day. 

Rumilda is a very active and above all enthusiastic woman who wants to progress every day.

loans.use: to buy beef, vegetables, chicken, ham, greens and other foods to make meals for sale.

loans.name: Mongina

texts.en:
Mongina 51 years old is married to Andrew and supports a family of 4 members. 

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 20 years earning an income of KES 14,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her farming. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting to help pay for her children's education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk production and expansion of his agriculture

loans.name: Callen

texts.en: Callen 30 years old is married to Lawrence and supports a family of 3 members. She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 9 years earning an income of KES13,000. She has applied for her first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to improve her farming by applying modern farming technology for more income gain and raise family living standards. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her farming. Her future hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: To improve her farming by applying modern farming technology for more income gain and raise her family living standards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk production

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 54 years old and supports a family of four members.

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 20 years, earning an income of KES 15,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her farming activity.

Her future hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Punkhan

texts.en:
Punkhan is 57-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and son in the small village of Gardabani district. The family has a plot of agricultural land, where they grow greens. In addition, they have 3 cows and Punkhan produces dairy products. She sells dairy products with the harvested greens locally. 

Punkhan wants to do additional business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 3000 GEL. With the received credit Punkhan will purchase a wide assortment of clothes in Turkey and will resell at higher price. She will gain profit and will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale locally at a higher price and so gain profit

loans.name: Huch's Group

texts.en:
Huch is aged 52 years, a mother of four children, living in Kampong Cham province. Rice farming and factory worker are the sources of her family’s income for more than five years. Through these businesses she could earn about 33,300KHR per day. 

Due to a lack of funds, she is now leading a group of three to apply for a new loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fee. She hopes to improve her family’s living through this loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer for improved rice yield and pay for plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new milling machine for more income gain.

loans.name: Segundo Felix

texts.es:
Segundo Felix tiene 33 años, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a sus 03 hijos en casa propia en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Conocido en el medio por su labor de crianza y venta de cuyes y borregos, también brinda servicios agrícolas en su caserío y anexos. Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de mayor cantidad de animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos lo que le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Segundo Felix is 33 years old, is in a relationship, and lives with his partner and three children in their own house in the district of Cayaltí, a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce and raising cattle that is located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region of the north coast of Peru.

Known locally for his work raising and selling guinea pigs and sheep, he also provides agricultural services in his village and the surrounding area. He is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan to buy a greater quantity of animals so he can generate better earnings. This will allow him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals for his business

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en: Farogat is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1982. She is divorced and has two children. She is working as an operator – cashier at Telecommunication Company. She raises and feeds her family alone. Recently she has been living with her parents. She is an honest and anxious person. Her mother is sick. She wants to have her treated in a medical clinic. Unfortunately, she doesn’t have enough money to have her mother treated in a hospital. She appealed to IMON and Kiva lenders to get a loan to have her mother treated in a hospital. She is hoping to be supported.

loans.use: to have her mother treated in a hospital.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa works hard to support her family. Narcisa is married and has a ice cream vending business in the Philippines.

Narcisa requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more ice cream to sell to her customers.

Narcisa has been in this business for 13 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Narcisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more ice cream to sell to her customers

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad works hard to support her family. Natividad is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Natividad requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Natividad has been in this business for 3 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Natividad would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a father whose greatest desire is to see his children grow up to be professionals. That thought fills Vincent with enthusiasm and inspiration. Vincent is 30 years old and works tirelessly to raise animals. Through these humble tasks, he aspires to offer all of his children a university education. Vincent learned to do farm work at a young age, thanks to his parents. He has a tiny plot of land -- just under half an acre – to farm and has always struggled to support his family. 

For over five years, his income source has been from selling milk, poultry, and vegetables. He supplements the meager income by doing other personal business. Vincent passionately loves dairy farming. Milking and feeding his own cow is the most enjoyable part about farming. He is very appreciative that dairy farming has been able to sustain farmers in his village. Milk, poultry and vegetables are very perishable, and these products require timely delivery to the market. One problem that he faces is delivering to the market on time. The Eldoret area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market. 

That is why Vincent is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. Farmers like Vincent will use the motorbike to transport passengers and farm goods to and from the market. They are suited for areas with poor road networks which are inaccessible by cars. They are also very cheap to acquire and maintain. Invest in Vincent’s future and you won't regret it. He is full of promise.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transporting farm produce and passengers locally

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a first time borrower of Ugafode Microfinance Ltd., Lira branch, applying for a loan of UGX 1,000,000. He sells car oil and lubricants along a busy street in Lira municipality.

Bernard has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to boost his business as he is located next to two motor vehicle garages and will fully make supplies to the garages. He is very grateful for Kiva lenders and Ugafode Microfinance Ltd. for the support given.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad toils the land and grows rice. She has engaged in farming for more than 20 years. She is a 50-year-old married woman with four dependents. Her oldest child is 21 and the youngest is 17. In addition to farming, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling assorted goods like noodles, cooking oil, soap, beverages and condiments. Her husband is a carpenter.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers. This would boost her farming livelihood, and be able to augment her income. Her ongoing yield will be more productive and this would enable her to purchase a nutritious diet for the whole family. With this, her income will become stable and start to pay her obligations. Thus, she could be able to expand her rice farming business and invest in any possible business venture.

Caridad hopes that she will be able to manage both of her businesses to be productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase plenty of animal feed so he can increase milk production and meet the needs of both his clients and family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts fuel for his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mirian Katiana

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente en Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.
En este lugar vive la señora Mirian, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 20, 16, 10 y 8 años, el mayor estudia en una universidad, el siguiente en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es Ing. Eléctrico.
Doña Mirian es  una gran ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon,  Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), hace poco también empezó a vender productos leudine (tratamientos de belleza, cosméticos, entre otros) Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja casi todos los días ya además de salir también vende en su casa donde tiene unas vitrinas en las que muestra sus productos, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana sus propios recursos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Lleva más de 8 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy necesarios para ella. Sus sueños son comprar un carro para salir a vender.
texts.en:
In the seaside resort of San Clemente in Portoviejo, the “1 de diciembre” loan group meets every fortnight. San Clemente is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many domestic and international tourists. There is a variety of beautiful places to see, and a diverse range of typical food dishes to taste.

And it is here that 40-year-old Mirian lives. She is married and has four children, ages 20, 16, 10, and 8 years old. The eldest is studying at university, the second at high school and the two youngest at primary school. Mirian’s husband is an electrical engineer.

Mirian is a housewife who, in order to earn her own income, makes a living selling Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She recently also began to sell Ieudine products (beauty treatments, cosmetics and more). Mirian sells door-to-door and works almost every day. She also receives customers in her home where she has a few display cases for her products. Mirian sells on credit and collects payments every week. She has been doing this work for ten years, allowing her to earn her own income.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and costume jewellery. Mirian has been with the loan group for more than eight years and she likes it because she really needs the loans. Mirian’s dream is to buy a car in which to travel to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and costume jewellery.

loans.name: Deimer

texts.es:
Deimer tiene 19 años de edad, vive en casa familiar en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería principalmente.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público, cuenta con una mototaxi propia con la cual brinda este servicio, tiene más de 01 año de experiencia en el rubro y clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo lo utilizará para realizar arreglos y reparaciones a su mototaxi que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto el espera mejorar el servicio que brinda lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Deimer is 19 years old and lives in his family home in the Pucará district of Jaén province in the Cajamarca region of Peru’s northern highlands. The locals in Pucará make their living mainly in farming and cattle-raising.

Deimer himself makes a living providing public transport services. He has his own motorcycle taxi that he uses for his work. He has one year’s experience in this work and has fixed customers who provide good personal and professional references.

Deimer will use this loan in order to carry out repairs to his motorcycle taxi, which is currently in bad condition. Deimer hopes that this loan will mean that he can provide a better service. He can thus earn a higher income and improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to carry out repairs to his motorcycle taxi, which is currently in bad condition.

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
Estella is 50 years old and married with eleven children. Five of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Estella is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Estella has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns income from farming rice. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 60 years old and married with six children.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs  in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nhom 11 - Luu Phuong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Quy, 58, has been an active member of her local Women's Union since 1996. Her family's monthly income mainly comes from agricultural production with the total amount of about VND 700,000 ($33). 

She has bad health and gets sick frequently. Quy is fully aware of the fact that using a degraded double-pit latrine has the risks of potential adverse effects on the health of her family members, her community and environmental contamination. However, she has not yet been able to construct a septic tank latrine due to a shortage of funds.  With this $381 loan, she will have a hygienic toilet installed in her home. This will improve the health or her family members and contribute to environmental protection. In the picture, she is the first person from the left.

loans.use: To pay for construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand-washing, for the health of her family

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha 55 years old is married to Charles and supports a family of 6 members. 

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 28 years earning an income of KES15,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her farming. 

Her future hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting to expand her farming and thus educate her children

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert, 33 years old, is married to Esther and supports four members in the family. He has been practicing dairy farming for the last 10 years, earning KES 15,000 per month. He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to improve his farming so as to increase production and meet both family and client needs. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to improve his farming so as to increase production and meet both family and client needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting to expand her farming and also educate her children

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
Jose tiene 55 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su esposa y su hijo de 15 años en el distrito de Querocotillo, una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café variedad catimore, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 20 años por lo que cuenta con mucha experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto el espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le permitirá generar mayores ingresos con lo cual mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 55 years old and lives in a privately-owned house built with rustic materials. José lives with his wife and 15-year-old son in the Querocotillo district, a small rural area where the people make a living in farming and cattle-raising. Querocotillo is in the Cutervo province of Cajamarca region in Peru’s northern highlands.

José works in farming: he has been growing Catimore coffee for20 years and therefore has a lot of experience with this business. José has a lot of good personal and professional references locally. 

José will use this loan to buy manure and fertilisers in order to look after his coffee crops. He hopes that this loan will allow him to offer his customers a better product and that he can thus earn a higher income and increase his quality life of life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilisers in order to look after his coffee crops.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo tiene 33 años, vive con su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos en casa propia en el distrito de Cañaris, provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 5 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en el mismo y con clientes que brindan muy buenas referencias de el. El préstamo será para la compra de abono para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha, con esto el espera mejorar la calidad del café que ofrece a sus clientes lo que incrementará su nivel de ventas y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 33 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his partner and his four children. The family lives in Cañaris district in the Ferreñafe province of the Lambayeque region on Peru’s northern coast. The locals in Cañaris make their living mainly in farming and cattle-raising.

Lorenzo has been making a living growing coffee for five years. He therefore has a lot of experience in this work, and has customers who provide good references. Lorenzo will use this loan to look after his crops and to hire labourers for the harvest. Lorenzo hopes that this loan will allow him to improve the quality of his beans, which will in turn result in higher sales and mean that Lorenzo can improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to look after his crops and to hire labourers for the harvest.

loans.name: Ma. Gloria

texts.en:
Ma. Gloria from GMA Cavite, Philippines, is married and has children. She is one of the beneficiaries of the employment program of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative.*

Ma. Gloria's job position is as a production line leader in a garment factory in Cavite. Her role is to maintain and process product quality on the production line and ensure operators achieve daily targets and outputs. One of the main concerns of factory employees is how to make ends meet for their families. As a minimum wage earner and with the increasing cost of living, their monthly salary is not enough to adequately provide for their family's needs so this forced Ma. Gloria to borrow from money lenders who charged very high interest rates and who require her to surrender her ATM (their salary is credited to her ATM) as her loan collateral. These low income employees sadly have no access to bank loans.

For this reason, Ma. Gloria is asking for your assistance to prevent her from submitting to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying them since the loan payment is deducted every pay day. She will appreciate much your positive response to her request to enable her to pay her month's obligations for her house and pay for her child's tuition fees as well. She wants her child to get a college education to allow her better opportunities in life.

Ma. Gloria meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work. CCT staff and volunteers conduct weekly fellowship meetings for the factory workers before their work routine to do Bible readings, prayer and discipleship sessions to encourage and inspire them to do their best and be the kind of person God wants them to be.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

loans.use: To pay for house rent and for her child's tuition fee as well.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from Binan, Laguna, Philippines. She married and is one of the beneficiaries of the employment program of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative.* She now works as a finishing line leader in the washing department of a garment factory in Cavite. Her job includes washing all the finished clothes and is also responsible for maintenance of the washing machine.

One of the main concerns of factory employees in the Philippines is how to make ends meet. As minimum wage earner and with the increasing cost of living, Teresita's income is not adequate to provide for their household needs. Sadly these low-income employees do not have access to banks and or other financial institution so Teresita resort to borrowing from money lenders who charge very high interest rates and require her to surrender her ATM (her salary is credited to her ATM acct.) as loan collateral.

Teresita is kindly asking your financial assistance to prevent her from being enslaved to loan sharks. Your help will enable her to recover her ATM and pay for the construction materials to build a house for rent to serve as her other source of income. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying them since the loan payment is deducted every pay day. Teresita aims to be the best in her line of work and hopes for promotion and higher salary.

She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work.  CCT staff and volunteers conduct weekly fellowship meetings for the factory workers before their work routine to do Bible readings, prayer and discipleship sessions to encourage and inspire them to do their best in life and be the kind of person God wants them to be. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

loans.use: To pay for construction materials to build a house for rent.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 48 years old and married with seven children, one of whom are in school.

Juliet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Juliet has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming rice and fattening pigs businesses.

Juliet aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 25 years old and single.

Rachel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rachel has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rachel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 57 years old and married with nine children, one of whom is in school.

Ma. Fe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, shampoo, diapers and other groceries.

Ma. Fe has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Ma. Fe aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, shampoo, diapers and other groceries.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is 38-year-old married woman. She lives in Telavi district with her husband Mamuka and 2 children. The source of income for the family is monthly rent from the commercial space they own. Ekaterine decided to start a new business and use the commercial space as a market. 

The Start up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 2200 USD. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of products for market and will work there with her husband. The income of the family will be increased and they will provide better future to their children with increased income. Ekaterine awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a start-up stock of products and open a market

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Abraham, a farmer in Nkubu. Abraham is involved in maize, poultry and dairy farming. He is engaged in milk and egg production for commercial purposes as opposed to many rural farmers, who are in it for subsistence. Abraham also grows maize for food and sales. These commercial activities place him in a better position to engage in other agriculture-related businesses, which, in fact, he does.

Abraham is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to construct a cow shed. This will help significantly in managing the animals’ health and hygiene. He has been in the farming business for at least 10 years. He has no plans to quit in the future as he finds farming to be both fulfilling and lucrative. However, his biggest challenges are the poor road network and lack of market. The cow shed, constructed through this loan, will later come in handy when Abraham scales up and introduces zero-grazing. The long-term impact is an increase in productivity and improved animal health. The additional income from this development will go to Abraham's children’s education.

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Sapitwa Group

texts.en:
Yanjanani is 32 years old and she has five children whom she looks after. She sells tomatoes, onions and vegetables.  She started this business in order to financially support her family. She is requesting another loan in order to buy more tomatoes and vegetables. 

Yanjanani plans to expand her business and to eventually have a good selling place in the market. She has found training on ‘Business Management’ very useful and she believes these will help her achieve what she wants for her market stall. As a woman she is proud to be independent

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions and vegetables for sale, so that she can support her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a toilet and shower, which will allow her home to be more comfortable and have better hygiene

loans.name: Moreka

texts.en:
Moreka 42 years old is married to Benard and supports a family of 4 members. 

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 20 years earning an income of KES 15,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her farming. 

Her future hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting and expanding her farming and also help pay for her children's education

loans.name: Ismayilkhan

texts.en:
Ismayilkhan has been married for 15 years and has three children. He is 44 years old. Ismayilkhan’s elder son is going to tenth class and his little son is going to fifth class. Ismayilkhan’s daughter goes to seventh class, and she plays the piano well. His family has been IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the occupied territory Fuzuli city for 23 years. Now they are living in Fuzuli region. 

Ismayilkhan has been in the taxi driver business for many years. This is Ismayilxan's second loan. He repaid his first loan on time. Today he wants to repair his car so has applied to Komak company. He needs a loan in the amount of 1,100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy a new car motor. Ismayilkhan is thankful to the Kiva organization and its lenders for help. In the future, he wants to help his children in education.

loans.use: to buy a new car motor to increase business. In the future he wants to help his children with their education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts for repair and maintenance, and fuel so as to offer better transport services to clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy assorted fresh vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar tiene 25 años de edad vive junto a su esposa e hija en la zona de Cayaltí donde sus pobladores se dedican al comercio de animales menores y agricultura, a una hora de la Provincia de Chiclayo en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Son una familia que se esfuerza por tener un mejor futuro, se dedican a la crianza de carneros y aves de corral en la parte posterior de su domicilio, Julio Cesar también percibe ingresos como mototaxista transportando a sus clientes que a la vez son sus vecinos. El ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de más animales para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto el espera obtener mayores ingresos para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar, 25, lives with his wife and daughter in the area of Cayaltí, where the people are engaged in animal sales and farming. The town is an hour from Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on Peru’s northern coast.  

They are a family that is striving for a better future.  They are engaged in raising sheep and poultry in the back of their house.  Julio Cesar also receives income as motor taxi driver transporting customers, who are also his neighbors.  He is requesting a loan to purchase more animals to increase his business’s stock and, in this way, he hopes to earn higher income, which will enable him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase his business’s stock.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is from Carmona, Cavite, Philippines. She is married and is one of the beneficiaries of the employment program of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative.* She has been employed in a garment factory in Cavite for nine years already and works as an end line line quality control. Her function is mainly to advise the assembly line supervisor when the number of defects has reached a limit. She also inspects output goods and separates defected goods from acceptable goods.
 
One of the main concerns of factory employees in the Philippines is how to make ends meet. As a minimum wage earner and with the increasing cost of living, Dolores' income is not adequate to provide for their household needs. Sadly these low-income employees do not have access to banks and or other financial institutions, so Dolores resorts to borrowing from money lenders who charge very high interest rates and require her to surrender her ATM (her salary is credited to her ATM acct.) as loan collateral.

Dolores is kindly asking your financial assistance to prevent her from being enslaved to loan sharks. Your help will enable her to redeem her ATM and pay for the graduation fees of her child. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying them since the loan payment is deducted every payday. Aurora aims to give her best in her line of work and hopes for promotion and higher salary.

She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work.  CCT staff and volunteers conduct weekly fellowship meetings for the factory workers before their work routine to do Bible readings, prayer and discipleship sessions to encourage and inspire them to do their best in life and be the kind of person God wants them to be. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

loans.use: To pay for her children's graduation fees and redeem her ATM.

loans.name: Yunuke

texts.en: Yunuke is 60 years old, married, and blessed with five children. She is a farmer and has been in this business for the last 20 years. She will use the loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm. She hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her future hopes are to improve her farming, make more income, and support her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm. She hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Julio Victor

texts.es:
Julio vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su esposa y 03 hijos menores de edad en el distrito de Querocotillo, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz y café, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de animales menores y realiza servicios como jornalero agrícola, tiene una parcela pequeña de terreno que alquila para la siembra de arroz, Julio se esfuerza por la labor que realiza. Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de cerdos y materiales para el mantenimiento de su corral, con esto el espera mejorar su negocio lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a permitirle mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Julio lives in his own house made of rustic materials together with his wife and 3 young children in the district of Querocotillo, a community that makes a living in agriculture, especially in the cultivation of corn and coffee, trade and raising livestock.  It is located in the province of Cutervo that belongs to the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú.

Julio works selling young animals and also as an agricultural day laborer.  He has a small parcel of land that he rents to plant rice.  Julio works hard at what he does.

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of pigs and materials to maintain his pigpens.  With this he hopes to improve his business which will generate greater income for him that will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and materials for the maintenance of his pigpen.

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad is a 23-year-old young client. Elshad is a widow and he has a son. He is IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives with his parents in Bilasuvar region. Elshad earns money raising and selling seasonal fruits (apples, cherries, pears,  etc.) at a local bazaar. He has been working in agriculture for three years and his monthly income is 200 AZN. He gets additional earnings working in a tea café. 

Fruit growing has greatly expanded in Azerbaijan because people have high demand for fruit. They like to eat them fresh or to use in order to prepare fruit juice, jam and fruit cakes. 

Elshad’s income doesn’t cover his family’s demands. He applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN in order to get good new fertilizers and repair his garden. This is his first loan. Please support him.

loans.use: to get good new fertilizers and repair his garden.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su menor hijo en casa propia en el distrito de Cañaris, comunidad dedicada a la ganadería y agricultura que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, realiza esta actividad desde hace 10 años por lo que cuenta con clientes fijos quienes dan buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la cosecha, con esto el espera mejorar la calidad de su café para ofrecerles un mejor producto a sus clientes, esto tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elmer, aged 29, lives with his wife and his young son in his own home in the Cañaris district, a farming and livestock community located in the Ferreñafe province of the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast. 

He has been growing coffee for the last 10 years, and has regular clients who have given him good personal and professional references. The loan will be used to buy plant food and fertilizer for his crops, and to pay for labor during the harvest, which he hopes will allow him to offer his clients a better product, increasing his earnings so that he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy plant food and fertilizer for his crop, and pay for labor during the harvest.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, diapers, soap and other personal care products for her general store business.

NWTF is re-listing Emma's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, diapers, soap and other personal care products.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en: Abubakar is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kadanya Biyar village. Abubakar joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Abubakar will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags.  This season, Abubakar has grand plans to harvest 40 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Abubakar now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to move to the city with his family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия жительница города Душанбе. Ей 46 лет. Она разведена мужем и у нее одна дочка. Дочке 23 года.  В городе Душанбе почти все молодежи и женщины занимаются швеей.  Зулфия тоже занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она занимается  этой деятельностью более  15 лет. В этой деле она опытная швея. Ей  в швейном деле нравится ежедневный доход, а также она обожает шить и кроить. Зулфия давно хочет отремонтировать свой дом. Но так как на эту цель у нее нет достаточных финансовых средств, она решилась обратиться за кредитом. За счет кредита она купить краски, обои, люстра, и другие стройматериалы  и на оставшуюся часть денег она решила купить мебель для дома. Зулфия хочет жить комфортно и уютно как другие жители города. Зулфия надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Zulfiya lives in Dushanbe city. She is 46 years old. She is divorced and she has one daughter. Her daughter is 23 years old. 

In Dushanbe, almost all young people and women work in tailoring. Zulfiya also works in sewing womens' clothes. She has been involved in this business for more than 15 years. She is an experienced seamstress in this business. In the sewing business, she likes the daily income, and she also loves to sew and cut. 

Zulfiya has long wanted to renovate her house. However, since she does not have enough funds for this goal, she decided to apply for a loan. She will buy paint, wallpaper, a chandelier, and other building materials with the loan. She has decided to buy furniture with the remaining money. Zulfiya wants to live comfortably and cosily like the other townspeople. Zulfiya is hoping for your support.

loans.use: to renovate her house and buy furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more timber to use to earn more income.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos Santos tiene 56 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico junto con su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos de 4 y 3 años de edad en el Distrito de Cañaris, una comunidad de clima frió, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Ferreñafe que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, realiza esta actividad desde hace 6 años. Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo que le permitirá tener una cosecha oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos que van a permitirle mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos Santos is 56 years old, and lives in his own home made of rustic materials with his spouse and their two young children, aged 4 and 3 years old, in the Cañaris district. This is a community with a cold climate whose population works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry, and is located in the province of Ferreñafe in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

He has worked in agriculture, specifically cultivating coffee, since he was 6 years old. He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan to purchase fertilizer to maintain his crop, which will allow him to have a good harvest to offer his customers, thereby increasing his earnings and improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Jamini

texts.en:
Jamini is a 51-year-old woman who lives in the small village of Palashbari in Alipurduar with her only son. She is illiterate and can only sign her name. Unfortunately, she had lost her husband so her son is the main income holder of the family.

Jamini is a housewife. Her son is associated with a firewood business and Jamini also helps her son in his business.  He purchases wood timbers from the villagers.  After cutting the timbers into small pieces, he resells these to the retail customers and the local people as fuel.  He established this retail business many years back and has been continuing until now.  His major problem is capital, as the prices of wood are increasing day by day, so he is not able to enhance his business. To help her son to continue with his business, Jamini has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).  

The loan will be used to buy more timbers for their firewood business.  She hopes that the extra income will allow her to improve her family's living conditions.  In the future, she plans to expand their business in a large scale with the profit.

She thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more wood for her existing business.

loans.name: Jyotsna

texts.en:
Jyotsna is a 37-year-old housewife who is married to Manatosh and lives in Alipurduar district. She is blessed with two sons. One of them is a student of grade 7 and the other one is in service. She is illiterate but knows how to sign her name. She could not receive an education due to the poor economic resources of her family.

Her husband keeps himself busy selling "panipuri" by wandering in a cycle van. Panipuri is a popular street snack. In the Bengali language, it is called "phuchka." It consists of a round hollow puri, fried crisp and filled with smashed potato and flavored water. Jyotsna works hard and manages the household work until night. She prepares "panipuris" at home and her husband sells them to different places in their village. As their "phuchka" is in great demand in her area, Jyotsna wishes to expand the business by purchasing different kinds of essential ingredients such as flour, tamarind, chili, chat masala, peas, potatoes, etc. to prepare more delicious "phuchka" to attract the customers. 

So she has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase the necessary ingredients to increase productivity, which will enable her to run the business smoothly.

Jyotsna wishes to get ahead with their existing business as it is a profitable one. 

Jyotsna is very thankful to BJS and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: To purchase more necessary ingredients for their Panipuri-selling business.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Lucia está en su ciclo número 6to del programa de comité de mujeres, son de la ciudad de Itá, también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, como un medio de ayuda para ellas y sus familias.
Una de las personas de este grupo es Felicita, una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de leche, comenta que su día empieza desde muy temprano todos los días, ya que lleva su producto para la hora del desayuno de sus clientes. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere seguir con su trabajo y sus esfuerzos para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar leche en cantidad, y con ello poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir mejorando cada día y ayudar a su familia de esa manera.
texts.en:
The “Santa Lucia” communal bank is in its sixth loan cycle with the women’s committee program, and is located in the city of Itá.  They are participating in the poverty elimination program as a means of helping themselves and their families. 
 
One of the people in this group is Felicita, a hardworking woman engaged in selling milk. She says that her day starts very early every day because she takes her product to her customers at breakfast time.  She is a very hardworking person that wants to continue working and striving to be able to help her family and her loved ones.

She is requesting this loan to purchase milk in bulk, and thus be able to meet customer demand.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving, which enables her to continue improving each day and help her family in this way.

loans.use: to purchase milk in bulk for sale.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
El Señor Arnaldo es de la ciudad de San Pedro, es técnico en electrónica y tiene un negocio de venta de aparatos celulares y accesorios.
En el futuro tiene como objetivo ampliar su negocio y tener un buen servicio  para sus clientes, es una persona que lucha por poder crecer y mejorar cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de repuestos para celulares y accesorios para poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Arnaldo is from the city of San Pedro.  He is an electronics technician, and he has a business selling cellular devices and accessories.

His objective for the future is to expand his business and to have good service for his customers.  He is a person who struggles in order to be able to grow and improve every day.

He is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy replacement parts for cell phones and accessories in order to be able to continue with his sales.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for cell phones and accessories.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Rory está en su ciclo número 10 del programa de comité de mujeres, son 21 mujeres muy unidad y trabajadoras, que por medio de su esfuerzo y lucha quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Todas ellas participan activamente en las actividades propuestas por el grupo, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común.
Felicia es una mujer muy proactiva y trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de ropas, y también tiene una librería. Ella tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella todo lo que vende, y así se viene abriendo camino con mucho esfuerzo y lucha.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas varias, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas, esforzándose por poder mejorar cada día y ayudar a sus seres queridos de esa forma.
texts.en:
The Kuña Rory group is in its 10th cycle with the women’s committee program.  They are 21 very united and hard-working women.  Through their efforts and struggles they want to improve their living conditions.  They all actively participate in the group’s proposed activities.  They help each other in order to reach their common objectives.
