El grupo llamado La Esperanza II; está en su ciclo número  4  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, todas se fijaron como meta poder crecer, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Adriana quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de utensilios de cocina que hace tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Ella está esforzándose para poder mejorar e ir superándose cada día.
Adriana pide este préstamo para poder comprar utensilios de cocina para poder tener un buen stock de productos que poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella esta agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The Esperanza II (Hope II) group is in its 4th cycle in the woman's committee program, where they all work and help each other be successful. All have the goal of being able to grow not only economically but also personally.

One of the members is Adriana, who through her efforts and continuous work selling kitchen utensils, has the means to be able to support her loved ones. she is trying to improve and be better every day. Adriana is asking for this loan in order to buy kitchen utensils in order to have a good stock of products to be able to offer her customers. she is thankful for the opportunity that she receives to improve every day.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils to sell.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El comité SAN EXPEDITO están en el 2do ciclo, son señoras muy capaces y trabajadoras que demuestran interés por las capacitaciones y por las charlas que van recibiendo para poder mejorar cada día.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maria, se la distingue por su espíritu emprendedor, es muy trabajadora e independiente, se dedica a la venta de ropas, exhibe en su propia casa como también lleva a vender de manera ambulante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día. En la foto hay 16 personas, ya que el grupo tiene 16 miembros, pero solo 14 solicitan del prestamo y las otras dos firman como codeudores.
texts.en:
The communal bank SAN EXPEDITO is in its second cycle. They are very capable and hardworking women who show interest in the trainings and the talks they are receiving to be able to improve each day.

One of the members is Maria, who stands out for her enterprising spirit. She is very hardworking and independent. She works selling clothing. She sells from her own home and also as a street vendor.

She requests this loan to be able to buy various garments in order to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is grateful for this opportunity that she receives to be able to improve each day. In the photo there are 16 people, since the group has 16 members, but only 14 request the loan and the other two are co-signers.

loans.use: to buy various garments to sell.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a hardworking married man with 4 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He is a farmer growing green tea and at the same time has a banana plantation. He is faced with hardships of price changes that keep fluctuating, however, he has a vision of constructing a house. Christopher has asked for a loan to construct his permanent home by buying building materials like bricks and cement.

loans.use: to construct his permanent home by buying building materials like bricks and cement

loans.name: Yuster

texts.en: Yuster is a 42-year-old single lady with 4 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. She deals in green tea, and at the same time has a retail shop that provides additional income. She is faced with the challenge of price fluctuation which disrupts the progress of her business. She has future plans of educating all her children to higher levels of learning. She has applied for a loan to buy green tea for planting.

loans.use: to buy green tea for planting.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He is in transport business and at the same time is an agent of star times and entertainment center. He has future prospects of establishing a transport fleet company. Patrick needs a loan to pay school fees for his children this second term.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children this second term.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a 42-year-old married woman with three dependents ages 11-19 years old respectively. She resides in Talibon, Bohol. She raises and sells hogs. For 11 years now she has been engaged in the hog raising business.

She is asking for a loan to purchase additional piglets. It helps her raise more pigs and in a few months to come, she will be able to sell them. Thus, it would augment her earnings and help her finances.

Fe is very grateful for the funds and she is doing her best to support the education of her three children for a brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to purchase  additional piglets

loans.name: Chrisostom

texts.en: Chrisostom is a married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer and at the same time has a retail shop that earns him more income. He is faced with challenges of weather changes that hinder good growth of his produce business. However, he has hopes of living a better life and increasing his income. He has asked for a loan to add stocks of maize flour, ground nuts and avocado to sell.

loans.use: to add stocks of maize flour, ground nuts and avocado to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 54-year-old married man with five children, living in Fort Portal Uganda. He has a business of distilling waragi, a local drink, in his area. To supplement his income, he does farming. He is faced with challenges of high competition that hinders progress of his business. Besides that, he is working very hard to have enough capital and a healthy family. Stephen asked for a loan to buy waragi, a local brew, to sell.

loans.use: to buy waragi, a local brew, to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an improved cow for milk production.

loans.name: Yeung

texts.en: Yeung, 34, is a mother of a small child, living in Kampong Cham province. Nowadays, her family’s living is dependent on rice farming, feeding pigs, and she has worked as a factory worker for fourteen years. Due to lack of funds, she is now applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pig feed to support her current businesses. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more income and expand her current businesses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pig feed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
A 61-year-old mother of two children, living in Kampong Cham province, Khen is a rice farmer and has been a factory worker for forty-three years.

She could earn about 53,300 KHR per day through this loan. Due to lack of funds to fulfill her needs, she is now taking out a Kiva loan via VisionFund to dig a well for her family’s use.

She hopes her family will have enough clean water to use and improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to dig a well for her family’s use.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Yai

texts.en: Yai is 42 years old and a mother of four children, three of whom are dependent children, living in Kampong Cham province. Growing rice on two hectares farmland and working as a construction worker are the sources of her family’s income. She has been involved in these businesses for ages and it earns her about 43,700 KHR per day. To fulfill her dream of expanding her farming, she is now applying for a Kiva loan to buy more farmland to expand her farming area. She hopes to earn more income and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more farmland to expand her farming area

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Luigj

texts.en: Luigj's wife, Tereze, who is in the picture, has been suffering for a long time from some severe illness in her backbone. The reason why they need this loan is to cover some medical examinations and treatment.

loans.use: to pay for medical examinations and treatments for his wife who's been suffering for a long time from backbone illness

loans.name: Sule Dangote

texts.en:
Sule Dangote is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Shawai Village. Sule Dangote joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.

In the past, Sule Dangote suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to improve his farming skills. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Sule Dangote has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support Sule Dangote can now ensure that his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Suzana is a maize farmer from Shawai village, Nigeria. In the past she suffered from poor harvests that crippled her ability to develop her farmland. She has now joined Kiva's field partner Babban Gona Farmers Organization to create a better life for her children.

As a Babban Gona farmer, Suzana has the chance to harvest up to thirty bags of maize per hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. Through a 37,218 NGN loan, she will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will increase her yields and bring her up to $2,000 per hectare.

With an ambitious goal of harvesting one hundred bags of maize this year, Suzana can now make certain that her children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: to have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds

loans.name: Chhoeut

texts.en:
Chhoeut is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest of Cambodia. He is 32 years old and lives in a wooden house with his wife. They have an 8-year-old daughter who lives at her grandparent's house in a village closeby, as they have lots of work for the moment. His family owns five hectares of cassava field and three hectares of rice field. 

In 2013 he joined the social company Soieries du Mekong in order to become a weaver, as his wife Chhoeut makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. He uses his weaving income to pay for the family's expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for the fields, and to repair his house. Thanks to the loan, he will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support him so he can keep making beautiful traditional handwoven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom-preparation-related fees

loans.name: Toro Blanco Group

texts.es:
El grupo formado en la ciudad de Caaguazú se llama Toro Blanco está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, el cual es un método para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una, y conforme a ello poder luchar por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sonia, quien se dedica a hacer comidas variadas para la venta, ella es muy buena en la elaboración de las comidas y es por eso que le va muy bien. Ella comenta que le gustaría poder tener un gran local de comidas donde poder ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser carne, verduras, hortalizas, condimentos y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de crecer.
texts.en:
The group, formed in the city of Caaguazú, is called Toro Blanco and is within the poverty elimination program, which is a method to recognize each person’s living conditions and fight to improve them.

One of the members is Sonia, who works making various foods to sell. She is very good at making food and that is why business is going well for her. She states that she would like to be able to have a great food establishment where she could offer her customers good service.

She requests this loan to be able to buy supplies to make her food, such as meat, vegetables, greens, condiments, and other things, in order to be able to continue with her work as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to grow.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, greens, condiments, and other supplies to make food.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, 45, lives in Kyenjojo and is married with four children aged ten, eight, six and four years. He deals in cattle and supplements his income through milk sales. A prolonged drought and high license fees in the cattle market are challenges for him.

James is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan through Kiva's field partner HOFOKAM to buy more cattle to sell. He is exploring cattle markets that may offer more attractive prices and wishes to educate his children to university level.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his garden by mulching it.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel runs a hardware shop. He has been in that business for seven years. He began the business to have income to develop himself. Emmanuel is a married man with three children, all of whom go to school. Emmanuel is requesting a loan to buy bags of cement, boxes of tiles, and iron sheets. With this loan, Emmanuel will be able to develop his family and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy bags of cement, boxes of tiles, and iron sheets for selling

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en: Mzia is a 54-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, daughter and son in Zugdidi district. Mzia's son works as a security guard and gets 300 GEL monthly, which is the only source of income for the family. Mzia wants to start a business and requested a loan. The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 3,100 USD. With the received credit she will purchase cows and will resell them at a higher price to gain profit. Mzia will be able to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase cows and resell them at a higher price

loans.name: Sreyneat

texts.en:
Sreyneat is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest of Cambodia. She is 19 years old and lives in a wooden house with her family. She has four brothers and sisters and is the fourth child in her family. Her family owns five hectares of rice fields and five hectares of cassava fields. 

In 2012 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Sreyneat makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her family's expenses. 

Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional handwoven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom-preparation-related fees

loans.name: Leap's Group

texts.en: Leap, 44, is a mother of three children, one of whom is in school, living in Kampong Cham province. Growing rice and corn provided her about 46,300 KHR for her family’s daily needs. She has been involved in this business for 16 years. Now she faces a problem of lacking money for farming, so she decided to form as a group to take a Kiva loan from VisionFund. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer, and pay for a plowing fee. She hopes that this loan will help to grow her business well.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, and pay for a plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Jyotsna

texts.en:
Jyotsna lives in Alipurduar, West Bengal. She is 46 years old and a married housewife. She, together with her husband, is raising two sons. One is a student, and the other is engaged in a small income-generating job. Jyotsna did not receive any formal education.

Jyotsna and her husband Kulen have been engaged in a bag-manufacturing business to earn for the family. They purchase raw materials from the market and stitch bags in their house. Their products include wallets, ladies’ bags, purses, school bags, etc. Her husband supplies the products to the market.

This business is the only source of income for the family, but in spite of their tireless work, they are unable to earn sufficient income. This meager income does not provide the family with a decent lifestyle, and they are unable to cover all the expenses. Though the customer demand is strong, they are unable to expand the business due to scarcity of capital.

Jyotsna is determined to succeed despite the many challenges, so she has asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to overcome the problems. She wants to purchase more raw materials for her business such as leather, cloth, gum, handles, buttons, and other necessary items, and she will fully use the loan for that purpose. She hopes the loan will enable her to reach her goal to build up a bag-manufacturing factory in the future.

She thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her bag-manufacturing business.

loans.name: Manzoora

texts.en:
Manzoora, age 41, is a married woman.  She deals in a business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Majedan

texts.en: Majedan is a 56-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo). He assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good-quality products and they make enough to meet their expenses. Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mumtaz is a 46-year-old married woman. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good-quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of three children.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy stitching material such as spools of thread in different colors, and packs of zippers and buttons, etc. to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of thread in different colors, and packs of zippers and buttons, etc. to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Chanleap

texts.en:
Chanleap is from Banteay Chmar, a village in northwest Cambodia. She is 34 years old and lives in a one-story house, made of pressed coated sheets and cement with her husband and her parents. Her family owns some chickens that run around the garden. In 2001 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. 

Chanleap makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the family's expenses and to repair the house. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional handwoven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom-preparation-related fees

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 47 years old. She is single and has a 25-year-old son who is in Polytechnic. Victoria sells sachet water and provisions in a container in front of a house she has rented. She has been selling sachet water for the past seven years. 

Victoria wants to expand her business by buying more water to sell, however her business capital is not enough for her to buy the water in large quantities. With this loan, she will buy more water, sell it and use some of the profit she makes to pay for her son's educational expenses.

loans.use: To buy sachet water in large quantities to sell

loans.name: Las Entequereñas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Entequereñas se formó en la ciudad de San Pedro, son 19 mujeres que se propusieron unirse para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Ana, quien cuenta con una verdulería, adquiere productos mediante la compra, pero también se dedica a la producción propia de verdulería.
Ella quiere seguir con su trabajo para poder ayudar a su familia, ya que ella es una de las que sostiene su casa. Es una persona realmente trabajadora que todos los días empieza su jornada de trabajo desde muy temprano.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de verduras para la venta, ya que con ello podrá seguir con su trabajo y tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The "Las Entequereñas" group was formed in the city of San Pedro by 19 women who chose to join together in bettering their quality of life. One of them is Ana, who works in a produce market. She acquires items to sell by purchasing them, but she also works to produce some items of her own.  She wants to keep working this job to support her family, since she is one of the people maintaining the household. 

Ana is a truly hard working person, who gets up early each day to begin work. She is requesting this loan to purchase vegetables to sell, so that she may keep working and have the means to support her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Kyrey está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde las integrantes se fijaron como metas ayudarse las unas a las otras y poder crecer de esa forma, no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona.
La señora Rossana, Ayuda al Sostenimiento de su familia con la venta de zapatos por pedidos que realiza. El  fin del préstamo que ella pide es para la obtención de más capital  para   la compra de zapatos para luego llevarlas a la venta. La señora es muy entusiasta y por medios de las capacitaciones quiere crecer y ayudar a su familia.
Este grupo se destaca ya que cada una de las integrantes está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para que sus familias tengan un mejor estilo de vida y no tengan que pasar por necesidades.
texts.en:
The Kuna Kyrey group is in its third loan cycle in the Women's Communal Bank program.The member's goals are to help one another and in this manner to grow, not only economically, but also personally. 
Rossana helps to support her family by selling shoes by special order. The purpose of the loan that she is asking for is to obtain more capital in order to buy shoes for resale. Rossana is very enthusiastic and by means of the trainings hopes to grow and to help her family.
This group stands out because each member puts forth their best efforts so that their families will not have to be needy and will have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Ratt's Group

texts.en: Ratt, 35, is a mother of six dependent children, three of whom are in school. They are living in Kampong Cham province. She has been involved in rice farming and fishing for 12 years and earns about 50,300 KHR per day. Due to a lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and pesticide and pay the plowing fee. She hopes to earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticide and pay plowing fees

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a 39-year-old woman. She is single and has two children who are 16 and 19 years old. She is into the sachet water business and has done this business for 18 months. She usually takes the water to bus terminals and schools to sell and sometimes places it in a container and sells it in front of her house. 

With this loan, Ama will be able to buy more water and sell it to increase her income. She hopes that one day she will be able to rent a shop where she will sell the water.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sachet water and sell them to increase her income

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene tres hijos, vive en casa propia de material rústico en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta comida como humitas, tamales, bebidas gaseosa, refrescos, entre otros, las ventas las realiza en el distrito de Pucará, tiene 5 años de experiencia en esta actividad por lo que cuenta con experiencia y con clientela fija que brinda buenas referencias de ella. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de maíz para la preparación de las humitas así como para la compra de ollas, baldes, platos, entre otros artículos para su negocio, con esto Lucia espera mejorar el servicio que brinda lo que le va a permitir incrementar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucia is 42 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and has three children. She lives in her own house made of traditional materials in the rural part of the district of Pucara, a community dedicated to agriculture and livestock, located in the province of Jaen, Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.

She sells food, such as humitas [a kind of tamal made from fresh corn], tamales, carbonated soft drinks, among other things, in the district of Pucara. Lucia has 5 years of experience in this activity so she has experience with repeat customers who provide good references for her. The loan is for the purchase of a greater quantity of corn to prepare the tamales as well as for buying pots, buckets, plates, and other items for her business. With these, Lucia hopes to improve the service she provides, allowing her to increase revenue and improve the quality of her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of corn as well as cooking utensils, plates and other items for her business.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo is a 53-year-old married man with eight children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His business is operating a boutique and at the same time, he does farming. He faces the challenges of low capital and competition that affect the progress of his business. Besides that, he has hopes of having a well- stocked shop of clothes. Deo intends to use the loan to buy clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Paskali

texts.en: Paskali used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He is a retailer in addition to being a dairy farmer who grows bananas that add more income for him. He is faced with the challenges of the high transport costs that make transporting bananas to the market very expensive and lowers his overall income. However, he has a future vision of having an educated family. He has asked for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Dy's Group

texts.en: Dy is 41 years old and a mother of four children, only one of whom is in school. She is a rural villager living in Battambang province. Fishing and working on other people's farm for a fee have been the sources of her family’s income for 12 years and she earns about 40,700 KHR per day. Due to a lack of funds, she is now applying for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy fishing supplies to support her business. She hopes this loan will help her to expend her current business.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 60-year-old single woman who works from home. She is a hard-working tailor who makes her unique clothing designs. She has professional skills in this domain, as she is well known by friends and neighbors. While she makes a steady income from her business, Khadija hopes to increase her sales to keep up with her growing expenses.

Today, Khadija is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua in order to pay her necessary medical expenses and she wants to buy an updated tailoring machine. 

She hopes to stay capable of improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her medical expenses and buy an updated tailoring machine

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo Renacer se formó con la unión de amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Lambaré, ellas son 19, y cada una se propuso ayudarse para poder dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener, además están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza para poder lograr sus metas. 
 La Sra. Ramona, es una  las integrantes quien gracias a su esfuerzo ha ido mejorando cada día. Ella es miembro de una familia de 5 integrantes, de ellos solo 2 trabajan. Ramona trabaja en la venta de prendas variadas, y con ello tiene los medios para que a su familia no les falte nada.
Ella sueña con poder tener una gran tienda para poder hacer sus ventas, en vistas a esa meta es que está trabajando y esforzándose. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas, y con ello poder seguir con su lucha y trabajo.
texts.en:
The Renacer group was formed in the city of Labaré by 19 women who are friends and neighbors, each of whom set out to give her family what she could never have herself. They are in a poverty elimination program which helps them achieve their goals. 

Ramona is one of the members, who thanks to her efforts has been growing every day. She is in a 5-person family of whom only 2 are working. Ramona sells a variety of clothing for a living, and through this income her family does not lack anything. She dreams of having a large store in which to conduct her sales, and this vision causes her to keep working hard and making an effort. 

She is requesting this loan to buy various clothing for sales, so that she may continue with her efforts and her work.

loans.use: to buy various clothing for sales.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego vive con su mama, comenta que es el primer integrante de la familia que está estudiando una carrera universitaria.
Está estudiando la carrera de psicología, por medio de su carrera quiere abrirse camino para poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Diego pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Diego lives with his mother and he says he is the first member of his family to study at the university. He is majoring in psychology and through his studies he hopes to have the opportunity to be able to help other people. Diego is asking for this loan to be able to pay his tuition and be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: pay his college tuition.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, se formó en la ciudad de Caacupé, con 18 mujeres, todas ellas mujeres jefas de familia, que están luchando por sus seres queridos, para poder darles todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Ilse, una de las integrantes, se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo, y comenta que por medio de este humilde trabajo se gana la vida. Ilse quiere mejorar sus ingresos para poder seguir dando a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Ilse pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas varias para la venta, como ser vinos, cervezas, gaseosas y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder ayudar a su familia, por medio de su trabajo y su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group called Kuña Guapa is in its second loan cycle of the women's group program. It was formed in the city of Caacupé, and it is made up of 18 women, all of them the heads of their families, who are fighting for their loved ones to give them everything that they themselves couldn't have.

Ilse, one of the members, works selling all kinds of drinks. She says that through this humble profession, she makes her living. Ilse wants to increase her income in order to continue giving her family everything that she couldn't have.

Ilse is requesting this loan to be able to buy various drinks to sell, such as wine, beer, soda, and others. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving to help her family, through her work and microentrepreneurship.

loans.use: To buy wine, beer, soda, and other drinks to sell

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is 27 years old, a married woman running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses.

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn agood amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Sattara

texts.en:
Sattara is a 24-year-old, married woman. She is been working at hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of 35000 PKR  to buy spools of threads in different colors and along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment.  This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors and along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment

loans.name: Bimaliha

texts.en:
This remarkable woman's name is Bimaliha. She is 59 years old. She lives with her husband, son and his children in the beautiful city of Khujand. In Khujand city the people are hospitable. 

Bimaliha is also a very good and industrious woman. She has a small cafe there and sells cakes (pirozhki). Thus Bimaliha supports her family. Since she does not have the comforts in the cafe, she has no customers. 

Bimaliha wants to buy new tables and chairs for customers. For this reason she applied for a loan. 

She believes that Kiva lenders will not refuse to help her, and thanks them because she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy new tables and chairs for customers

loans.name: Faraja Mavurunza Group

texts.en:
Nuru, who is in her mid 30s, is married with one kid who is still at school.  She has been selling charcoal for four years now.  She works from 06 am to 08 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Nuru's 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy sacks of charcoal and sold madila as  well.  She is doing fine and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.  She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment, bought a plot of land, started building her house and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to  buy sacks of charcoal to meet her customer's demands.  She dreams of finishing building her own house.  

Nuru will share this loan with her loan group, Faraja Mavurunza, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to meet her customer's demands.

loans.name: Santaroseña Group

texts.es:
Santaroseña es grupo antiguo y bastante unido, con  la  plena convicción de trabajar y ayudarse todas juntas, así facilitar el progreso y calidad de vida de todas, crecer como personas y también en lo económico.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Hilda, quién realiza trabajos de confección, ropas de todos los modelos y tamaños. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que pone todo de sí para poder crecer y por medio de su trabajo dar a sus seres queridos una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Hilda pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de máquinas de coser industriales para poder mejorar su trabajo y mejorar sus condiciones d vida. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Santaroseña is a old and closely knit group that has the conviction to work and help one another. In this way they will facilitate the progress and quality of life for everyone, and grow both as people and economically.
One of the members is Hilda, who works as a seamstress, making clothing of all styles and sizes. She is a very hard-working person, who does all that she can to grow, and through her work, to give her loved ones a dignified life, lacking nothing.
Hilda is requesting this loan to be able to buy an industrial sewing machine to improve her work and improve her living conditions. She is grateful for the opportunity that she has received to be able to improve her work.

loans.use: to buy industrial machines to improve the clothing manufacturing.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, por medio de sus estudios quiere abrirse camino y ser una buena profesional que ayude a las demás personas.
Comenta que su familia siempre la apoya y que gracias a ello está pudiendo seguir con sus sueños.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma estar más cerca de sus metas.
texts.en:
Sonia is studying nursing.  Through her studies she hopes to make her own way and to be a good professional so that she can help other people.
She says her family always supports her and thanks to them, she able to pursue her dreams.

She is requesting this loan to pay her tuition costs, and thus get closer to her goals.

loans.use: pay college tuition.

loans.name: Nadira

texts.en:
Nadira is a proud owner of a low cost private school in a small town. Currently her school provides education to 283 students, some of whom are studying for free. Nadira tries to accommodate children from vulnerable households because for her education cannot be kept for only those who can afford it. 

Recently she requested a loan for 100,000 PKR to purchase a desk, get the school water dispenser repaired and set up a small stationary shop within the school premises.

loans.use: to purchase a desk, get the school water dispenser repaired and set up a small stationary shop within the school premises.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is 41 years old. She is a widow and has two children who are 17 and 25 years old. Both her children are schooling. 

Akua sells sachet water and has done this business for 10 years. She does not own a shop, and usually sells her water at bus terminals and at home. 

Her dream is to own a store one day, where she will be able to sell the water in large quantities. 

She will use this loan to buy more water to sell and increase her income so that she can manage her home out of the profit she  makes.

loans.use: To buy sachet water and sell to her customers

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida  is 31 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Zahida’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Zahida  has applied for a loan of 35000 PKR, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires along with some auto spare parts and tools for his vehicle. This will help him to drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Zahida  is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with some auto spare parts and tools for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Jose Ellery

texts.en:
Jose Ellery hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is a married man with five  children and his youngest child is 15.  He engages in buying and selling of fresh fish. He buys fresh fish from the fisherman at sea and he sells them to the locals in his community.  He has been engaged in the fish vending business for six years.

He is asking for a loan to purchase a variety of fish, fuel for the motorboat and a battery for his flash light. These would then enable him to augment his sales and provide a wider variety of fresh fish. Thus, it helps him provide his family with nutritious meals and better shelter to live.
 
He dreams of sending  his children to school for a much brighter future and also improve the family's livelihood status.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fish, fuel for the motorboat and a battery for his flash light

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a Solar Solution for her business. She wants to support her family and increase her income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for college fees.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is 46 years old, a married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of seven children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. 

She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is a 30-year-old married man with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a restaurant business and earns a monthly salary on top of a taxi business. He is facing challenges of competition that hinder growth of his business. However, he is working very hard to ensure that he builds a permanent house. 

Ivan has asked for a loan to buy food stuff for the restaurant to cook and sell.

loans.use: to buy food stuff for the restaurant to cook and sell.

loans.name: El Hob El Sadek Group

texts.en:
Zeinab is the featured borrower for El Hob El Sadek Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Zeinab is a 34-year-old lady who started 17 years ago working in a hospital in the cleaning services section to cover her needs and expenses and to help her poor family. 

Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to prepare herself for her wedding day. Without this loan Zeinab will not be able to achieve her dream of preparing a special wedding day. Zeinab is the lady standing on the right of the photo.

With respect to the other group members, Fatima is the lady standing on the left, Layla is the lady sitting on the right, and Zeinab is the lady sitting on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to prepare for her wedding day

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en: Jameela is a 48 year old married lady. She has been running a school with the help of her brother for the last five years. The school is currently providing education to 132 children with the help of 5 teachers. She requires a loan of 100,000 PKR to purchase school furniture along with stationery items. "My brother helps me run the school and encourages me to face challenges and grow but lack of capital funding is a constant constraint and can only be met if my loan is approved", Jameela said.

loans.use: to purchase school furniture along with stationery items.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is a thirty seven year old married woman with four children between the ages of five and fifteen years. Her husband is a commercial driver and she sells sachet water for a living. Yaa has been selling sachet water for eight years. 

She would like to expand her business by buying more water to sell. She believes this will help her in supporting her husband in taking care of their four children.

loans.use: To buy bags of sachet water for resale and to help support her husband and their four children

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La Sra. Nancy está estudiando para ser maestra universitaria, comenta que quiere enseñar en universidades y poder ayudar a las personas que quieran aprender como ella.
Nancy está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder realizarse como persona y como profesional.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de útiles, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus estudios. Ella agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Nancy is studying to be a college professor. She says that she wants to teach in universities and be able to help the people who want to learn like her.

Nancy is putting forth her best effort to realize herself as a person and as a professional.

She is requesting this loan in order to cover school supply costs, so that she can continue her studies. She is thankful for this opportunity that she is receiving to improve each day.

loans.use: To cover school supply costs

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser un buen criminalista, quier poder ayudar a la sociedad por medio de sus conocimientos, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar sus cuotas, y eso le fue de mucha ayuda en poder luchar por sus metas.
Cesar pide este préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente sus cuotas, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y luchar por sus sueños.
texts.en:
Cesar is putting forth his best effort to be a good crime investigator. He wants to be able to help society through his knowledge. He says that he used the previous loan to pay his tuition, which was very helpful to him as he fights for his goals.

Cesar is requesting this loan to be able to pay his tuition again, and be able to continue his studies as he has been. He is thankful for the opportunity that he is receiving to grow and fight for his dreams.

loans.use: To cover college costs

loans.name: Rugoye Group

texts.en:
Samweli who is in his mid 20s is single with no children.  He has been running a library business for three years now.  He works from 08am to 10pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Samwel’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He will use this loan to buy good telephone chargers, to sell CD's and to burn music on CD's.  He dreams of owning a mini supermarket.

Samwel will share this loan with his loan group Lugoye which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy good  telephone chargers, to sell CD's and  to burn music on CD's

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
55-year-old Mercedes owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like sugar, cooking oil, eggs, assorted canned goods, firewood and toiletries. She is married to a fisherman. They have four children ages 16-29 years old.

She is asking for a loan to buy stock for the store like beverages, condiments, toiletries and other goods. This will enable her to provide a variety of stock and attract buyers to purchase. Thus her income will slowly improve and she will be able to provide her children with good food. 

In the future, she  dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks for the store

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 29 years old, married and blessed with 4 children. She is a farmer and has been in this business for the last 5 years. She will use the loan from Vision Fund Kenya to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm. She hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her future hopes are to improve her farming, make more income and support her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm and hopes this will enable her to have better farm produce for sale.

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en:
Ofelya is 63 years old and she lives with her husband in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Ofelya is a pedagogue and she has worked in her specialty already for 30 years. Now she works at the school as a teacher of Armenian history. She is a respected and beloved teacher at the school, and she tries to make her lessons very interesting and attractive for the pupils. 

She mentions each person must know the history of his nation as properly as it is possible, and school years are the best during which the teacher slowly and thoroughly gives enough information and knowledge proper to the age of the pupil. So as Ofelya mentions, she works due to the school program, but she wants to make her lessons more colorful and interesting through some didactic materials. 

She needs this Kiva loan in order to buy a computer, which will give her a chance to make her lessons more attractive and interesting for the pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer, which will give her a chance to make her lessons more attractive and interesting for the pupils

loans.name: Johan Manuel

texts.es:
Johan es un joven de 20 años que se encuentra estudiando, es una persona humilde, muy acomedida, responsable, para estudiar tiene que realizar largos desplazamiento y como sabe que su familia no tiene para pagarle el transporte monto un negocio de reparación y mantenimiento de bicicletas.
Esta persona monto este proyecto con el ánimo de  cumplir el mayor deseo de su madre que es tener una casa propia y ahora que lleva un año de operación está cada vez más con la idea de comprarle una casa a su madre.
Johan solicita un préstamo para la compra de repuestos de bicicleta.
texts.en:
Johan is a 20 year old young man who is a student. He is a modest, helpful and responsible person. He has to make long trips to get to his place of schooling. Since he knows that his family doesn't have the money to buy him transportation, he opened a bicycle maintenance and repair business. 
He has started this project with the hope of fulfilling the dream of his mother, which is to have her own house. 

He now has a year of operation under his belt, and continues with the hope of buying a house for his mother. Johan is asking for a loan to buy replacement parts for bicycles.

loans.use: to buy bicycle parts.

loans.name: Memona

texts.en:
Memona is 44 years old and a married woman. She is been in the business of beauty parlor for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her best providing services she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor.  That is why she has applied a loan of 35000 PKR  to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers, leading to profits to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to attract more customers, leading to  more profits to be able to build her own house.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida, age 53, owns a low-cost private school.Ten years ago she started her school on a micro-level, and since then has been continuously working towards its development. 

She has recently requested for a loan of PKR 100,000 and aims to purchase furniture for different classrooms. 

Khalida is proud of the 60% female enrollment in her school and plays an active role in encouraging parents to send girl children to school.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for different classrooms.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel esta estudiando la carrera de veterinaria, por medio de su carrera quiere poder abrirse camino al mundo profesional y ser una persona útil, comenta que mediante su préstamo anterior pudo pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con sus estudios.
Joel pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios, luchando para poder cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Joel is studying to be a veterinarian. Through his degree, he wants to clear a path for himself to the professional world and be a useful person. He says that with his previous loan he was able to pay his school fees, which greatly helped him to be able to continue with his studies.

Joel is again asking for a loan to cover his school fees, and with this, he will be able to continue with his studies, fighting to be able to fulfill his goals.

loans.use: To cover college fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay college fees

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is 27 years old and a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 30000 to purchase more animals to improve her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.en:
Kimberly operates a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells various merchandise ranging from biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, soap and many others. She is a married woman with four dependents ages 9-13 year old respectively. She needs funds to improve the stocks of her store.

Kimberly has requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to buy stocks for the store like soft drink, beverages, canned goods,rice and charcoal.  These resources are essentials in keeping hr store full of stocks, causing more buyers to shop.

With the additional capital, she is determined to improve her livelihood and support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks for the store, like soft drinks, beverages, canned goods, rice and charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her supply of maize and beans to sell to more customers.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Antonio se formo en la ciudad de Encarnación, donde las integrantes están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar por mejorar.
Todas las integrares están muy emocionadas por mejorar sus vidas, pero entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Silvia, quien es modista, es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, y es por ello que ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le hace muchos pedidos. Ella esta contenta por estar dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The San Antonio group was formed in the city of Encarnación, where the members are in the poverty elimination program, in order to be able to know each other's situation in life and accordingly to be able to work for improvement.

All of the members are very excited about improving their lives but among them stands out Silvia, who is a tailor.  She is a woman who is very good at what she does and it is for that reason that she already has a very good clientele that always orders a lot from her.  She is happy to be in the poverty elimination program since it will be of great help to her.

She is requesting this loan to be able to purchase fabric, thread, elastic, buttons and other items, and in this way to be able to continue with her tailoring as she has been doing it.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, elastic, buttons and other items to use in tailoring.

loans.name: Elly

texts.en: Elly is 42 years and has been running an electronic shop for seven years. He began the business in order to earn a living. Elly is a married man and a father of two children who go to school. Elly is a hard working man who is seeking credit to buy phones and phone accessories to meet customer demands and family needs.

loans.use: to buy phones and phone accessories for selling.

loans.name: Tehzeem

texts.en: Tehzeem is a 44-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband. They have been doing a business of cattle sales and purchases for many years. Tehzeem fully supports and assists her husband with his work. They currently have a few goats. Now, Tehzeem has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR, which they used to purchase more goats to sell in the market, to earn good profits and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to sell in the market

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy flour, oil, sugar and charcoal for cooking bites.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
At the age of 39, Asia is a hardworking woman who has 5 children. 

Asia sews clothing for people in her community. She is quite popular for her stitching skills. Her work managed to bring the family out of the financial crisis they were facing at the time. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Asia has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new sewing machine, spools of thread, and lace so she can consistently meet the demands of her customers. 

Asia aspires to save money for her family's prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, spools of thread, and lace so she can consistently meet customer demand.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en: Gocha is 35 years old. He lives in the small vilage of Sighnaghi District with his pensioner mother. Gocha is involved in agricultural activities and owns a small vineyard and a plot of agricultural land, where he grows cereals. Besides these activities, he works physically to generate profit. Gocha decided to start a husbandry business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,000 GEL. With the received credit, he will purchase a cow and piglets. He is a very hardworking man and does his best to provide better living conditions for his pensioner mother.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and piglets and start a husbandry business

loans.name: Mufram

texts.en: Mufram is a 45-year-old, married woman. She has been in the business of cattle sales and purchases for the past five years. Mufram buys animals (baby goats & calves etc.), brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. Currently she has a few goats. Now, Mufram has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of PKR 30,000, which she used to purchase more goats to sell in the market, to earn more profits for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to sell in the market

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is a 31-year-old married woman who has four children. She has been running a business purchasing and selling animals. She buys baby goats at cheap prices and, after raising them for one or two years, she sells them at a profit to different markets in the city. Her business provides enough income to support her family; however, she needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, health and clothing. Khadija has availed a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to buy more baby goats to sell to expand the business, and that will help in improving her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats to sell to expand the business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy, 42, hails from Talibon, Bohol. She operates an eatery, where she prepares and sells home-cooked meals. She also runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling goods such as biscuits, coffee, sugar, soap, cooking oil and condiments. Mercy is married and has 4 children, whose ages range from 8 to 18. 
 
Mercy is asking for a loan to buy groceries for the store and additional capital for food vending. These supplies will enable Mercy to prepare a variety of meals and boost the stocks of her store. Thus, her income will start to stabilize, which will enable her to pay her obligations. In the future, Mercy would like to expand both of her sources of income to support the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy groceries for the store and additional capital for food vending

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and bricks and to pay for labor for his house construction.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Piedad Del

texts.es:
Piedad es una mujer de 36 años de edad, que está dispuesta a realizar un gran esfuerzo para sacar su familia adelante, pues ante la falta de empleo busco una alternativa para generar recursos que necesita mucho su familia por ello quiere empezar un negocio que será una Berbería para lo que necesita un pequeño monto para comprar unos implementos indispensables y aprovechar los conocimientos que adquirió estudiando.
Con el monto solicitado comprara una máquina, espejo, sillas y utensilios, este préstamo permitirá que una mujer tenga alguna herramienta para labrar el futuro de su familia
texts.en:
Piedad is a woman of 36 who is ready to make a great effort to get her family ahead, since, faced with the lack of employment, she sought an alternative for generating the resources that her family needs so much. For this reason, she wants to begin a business, which will be a barber shop, for which she needs a small amount in order to buy some essential tools and take advantage of the knowledge that she acquired in school.

With the amount she has applied for, she will buy a machine, mirrors, chairs, and tools. This loan will allow this woman to have the tools to work for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a machine, mirror, chairs, and tools so that this woman will have the tools to work for the future of her family.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margret is 62 years old, married and is blessed with 5 children. She is a dairy farmer and has been in this business for more than 12 years now. She will be using the loan to buy dairy feeds and hay for her dairy cows and hopes this will enable her to get more milk for sale. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her future hopes are to improve her dairy farming, make more income and support her family.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds and hay for her dairy cows
